title: Tech Lead Infrastruktur och Messaging
description:
*Forma framtidens betalningsinfrastruktur – där du behövs!* 




  





*Bankgirot söker en Tech Lead Infrastruktur och Messaging till en växande del av organisationen i Stockholm. Bankgirot har en unik position på Sveriges betalmarknad, som just nu genomgår sin största transformation i modern tid. Vår IT-organisation växer för att utveckla framtidssäkra lösningar som uppfyller internationella standarder och regelverk. Samtidigt säkerställer vi att det nuvarande betalsystemet fungerar stabilt och säkert – varje dag.* 




  





*Arbetet med att utveckla framtidens betalningsinfrastruktur är i full gång och vi behöver dig som vill vara en del av resan. Som Tech Lead inom infrastruktur och Messaging kommer du att spela en viktig roll i uppdraget att säkerställa framtidens betalningsinfrastruktur på ett teknikbolag där vi har ett stort hjärta för uppdraget – och varandra.* 




  





**Din roll** 




 Som Tech Lead inom grundläggande infrastrukturtjänster kommer du att ansvara för design, implementering och optimering av Bankgirots IT-infrastruktur. Du blir en sammanhållande länk mellan teknikteamet, driftorganisationen och utvecklingsavdelningen, och du säkerställer att vår tekniska plattform möter både nuvarande och framtida behov genom kontinuerlig förbättring.
 



  





 Ditt arbete kommer att inkludera drift och automatisering av Bankgirots grundläggande plattformar för virtualisering och containerteknik samt meddelandehanterare. Du har kompetens inom Kafka, Linux och Kubernetes och har kunskap om vanligt förekommande virtualiseringsplattformar.
 



  





 Du ansvarar för att:
 



  




* Säkerställa en robust, säker och effektiv utveckling och drift av infrastrukturen.
* Utveckla och implementera strategier för grundläggande infrastrukturtjänster samt etablera effektiva arbetssätt.
* Leda och koordinera tekniska projekt kopplade till design, implementering och underhåll av infrastrukturen.
* Stödja och coacha teamet genom kunskapsöverföring och mentorskap.



  





**Vi söker dig som har** 




 Vi söker dig som har gedigen erfarenhet av IT-infrastruktur, inklusive server, nätverk, lastbalansering och datacenter. Du har en stark förståelse för IT-arkitektur och säkerhet inom central IT-infrastruktur samt erfarenhet av DevOps och automatisering. Din djupa kompetens inom operativsystem, framför allt Linux och Kafka tillsammans med erfarenhet av Infrastructure as code och verktyg som Ansible, gör att du kan skapa och underhålla effektiva och skalbara system.
 



  





 Du har kunskap om containerorkestrering, exempelvis Kubernetes, och en god förståelse hantera säkerhet i en reglerad bransch samt en trygghet i coachning av mer juniora medarbetare. Det är särskilt meriterande om du har börjat din karriär som infrastrukturtekniker och därefter utvecklats vidare inom automatisering och DevOps.
 



  





 För att trivas och lyckas i rollen tror vi att du uppskattar ledarskap och mentorskap och att du motiveras av att samarbeta i en agil miljö där innovation står i centrum. Med din analytiska förmåga och strukturerade arbetssätt leder du teamet och bidrar till att utveckla hållbara och moderna lösningar.
 



  





**Ett utvecklande arbete med bra förmåner** 




 Som vår nya kollega blir du en del av ett kompetent och positivt team där vi samarbetar och sätter högt värde på varandras kompetens och erfarenheter.
 



 Vi satsar mycket på hälsa och välmående och erbjuder generösa förmåner för dig som medarbetare.
 



  





**Övrig information** 




 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning baserad i Liljeholmen i Stockholm. Du behöver ha goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska.
 



  





 Innan anställning beslutas genomförs en säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585).
 



  





**Intresserad?** 




 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Bankgirot med Nexer Recruit.
 



  





 Har du frågor eller funderingar? Kontakta gärna rekryteringskonsult Johanna Värmfors: johanna.varmfors@nexergroup.com eller +46 730 821 230 alternativt Artan Bitiqi: artan.bitiqi@nexergroup.com eller +46 723 61 28 44.
 



  





 Läs om fler lediga tjänster från Bankgirot här.
 



 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
 



  





**Om Bankgirot** 




 Bankgirot är ett svenskt clearinghus och teknikbolag med över 60 års erfarenhet av att leverera finansiell infrastruktur till banker. I samverkan med betalsektorn ser vi till att privatpersoner och företag enkelt kan göra överföringar och betalningar.
 



  





 Bankgirot säkerställer att det nuvarande betalsystemet fungerar felfritt, samtidigt som vi utvecklar framtidssäkrade lösningar. Vi säkrar och utvecklar Sveriges betalningar.
 



 Läs mer på www.bankgirot.se

title: IT-arkitekt -AMF i Stockholm
description:
**Vi söker en IT-arkitekt som vill driva effektiva och hållbara lösningar med och för AMF i Stockholm!**
 Vi drivs enligt ömsesidiga principer, vilket betyder att all vinst går tillbaka till våra kunder. Vill du som vi se våra kunders pensioner att växa genom att göra smarta och kostnadseffektiva val. Här har du en central roll där du påverkar AMFs IT-landskap och arbetar med både strategiska initiativ och operativa lösningar.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
* Ett meningsfullt uppdrag där du bidrar till att skapa trygghet för miljontals pensionssparare genom att utveckla stabila och kostnadseffektiva IT-lösningar
* En arbetsgivare med en tydlig ambition att arbeta hållbart, vilket genomsyrar både investeringar och verksamhetens utveckling
* En roll med stort mandat, frihet och påverkansmöjligheter där du tillhör vår centrala arkitektfunktion där alla arkitekturella beslut för AMF tas
* En stabil och långsiktig arbetsgivare - AMF är ett av Sveriges största pensionsbolag och erbjuder en trygg arbetsplats med långsiktiga karriärmöjligheter
* Balansera arbete och fritid med flexibilitet, inklusive möjlighet till visst distansarbete


**Det här gör du hos oss**
 Som IT-arkitekt på AMF har du en central roll i att vara med och utveckla ett modernt och kostnadseffektivt IT-landskap som möter både dagens och framtida. Du arbetar med en mix av egenutvecklade och standardlösningar, alltid med fokus på långsiktighet och hållbarhet. Rollen innebär nära samarbete med andra arkitekter, utvecklingsteam och verksamhetsansvariga för att säkerställa att IT-strategi och målarkitektur realiseras.
   

  

**Du Kommer Bland Annat**
* Vara med och utveckla målarkitektur
* Medverka och i vissa fall leda arbetet i inledande faser i nya initiativ
* Genomföra analyser och ta fram rekommendationer och beslutsunderlag
* Driva eller medverka i framtagande av övergripande lösningsförslag och säkerställa att de är långsiktiga, förvaltningsbara och kostnadseffektiva.
* Kontinuerligt effektivisera och förenkla IT-landskapet
* Vara med och utveckla arkitekturfunktionen tillsammans med övriga arkitekter
* Ta fram och säkerställa att relevant arkitekturdokumentation finns på plats.
* Vara involverad i övergripande arkitekturfrågor och operativt arbete i att realisera IT-lösningar


**Ditt team och arbetsplats**
 Du blir en del av AMF:s arkitekturfunktion som består av verksamhets-, informations- och IT-arkitekter. Vårt team präglas av samarbete, och vi har höga ambitioner både för våra lösningar och för hur vi arbetar tillsammans. Du kommer att vara en central punkt för AMF och samarbeta med AMF på alla nivåer.
   

  

 Vi sitter i trevliga lokaler centralt i Stockholm nära T-centralen. Vi arbetar agilt enligt SAFe med PI-planering och tvåveckorssprintar.
   

  

**Mer om dig**
 Vi söker dig som har flera års erfarenhet att design och realisera IT-lösningar och du känner dig trygg med att leda arkitekturarbete tillsammans med andra för att skapa kostnadseffektiva, skalbara och långsiktigt hållbara IT-lösningar. Du har flera års erfarenhet av att arbeta som IT arkitekt och att utveckla IT-lösningar som möter verksamhetens behov utifrån applikations- och integrationsarkitektur. Du har även erfarenhet av olika standardtjänster/applikationer. Har du erfarenhet av hybridmiljöer med både on-prem och molnlösningar är det ett stort plus.
   

  

 Vi tror att du är en analytisk och strukturerad person som tar ansvar för att driva arkitekturarbetet framåt. Genom din kommunikativa förmåga och ditt engagemang får du med dig intressenter och säkerställer att strategiska beslut blir verklighet.
   

  

 Du är van att kommunicera med olika målgrupper och använder modeller och dokumentation för att visualisera arkitekturens riktning. Dessutom har du en förmåga att bryta ner problem och presentera dem på ett tydligt och pedagogiskt sätt för olika intressenter.
   

  

**Intresserad?**
 I den här rekryteringen har vi valt att samarbeta med Ada Digital som strävar efter en transparent, inkluderande och snabbrörlig rekryteringsupplevelse. Vi vill veta mer om dig och din potential! Du söker tjänsten enkelt och behöver inte bifoga några dokument. Det räcker med en motivering till varför du söker tjänsten och om du saknar CV kan du bifoga din LinkedIn-profil. Följ sedan din ansökan live via vår hemsida. Urvalet sker löpande och tjänsten kan bli tillsatt före sista ansökningsdatum. Är du nyfiken och vill veta mer innan du söker? Hör av dig till ansvarig rekryterare. Vi ser fram emot att få kontakt med dig!

title: Teknisk Chef (CTO) till Arbetsförmedlingen
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
Arbetsförmedlingen, VO IT, IT-avdelningen. Vi söker Teknisk Chef (CTO) till Arbetsförmedlingen. Arbetsförmedlingen är mitt i en stor transformation. Vi söker en erfaren och inspirerande teknisk chef. Som Teknisk chef (CTO) kommer du att spela en avgörande roll i att driva de digitala aspekterna av transformationen och forma framtidens myndighet. Nu har du chansen att få bygga upp och leda enheten Tekniska kontoret (CTO Office). Är du den engagerande och visionära teknisk chef vi letar efter, som leder ditt team med självförtroende?
   

  

**Vilka är IT på Arbetsförmedlingen**
 VO IT är en central kraft i myndighetens transformation. Genom att digitalisera och automatisera våra processer bidrar vi konkret till att flera människor kommer i arbete. Vi är stolta över att tillämpa den senaste tekniken för att nå våra gemensamma mål, vi är exempelvis ledande inom offentlig sektor när det gäller nyttjande av AI.
   

  

**Mer om rollen**
 Som Teknisk Chef kommer du att vara teknikledare för hela Arbetsförmedlingen, övervaka alla tekniska aspekter av myndighetens transformation. Chefen för Tekniska kontoret är tillika myndighetens chefsarkitekt. Teknisk chef kommer att tillsammans med sina medarbetare på Tekniska kontoret arbeta nära verksamhets - och teknikteam för att skapa myndighetens tekniska ramverk och gå i spetsen för dess genomförande. Tekniska chefen kommer att ingå i VO IT:s ledningsgrupp och rapporterar till IT Direktör (CIO).
   

  

 Utöver att leda tekniska initiativ förväntas du också visa starkt ledarskap och beslutsfattande.
   

  

**Ansvar:**
* Driva och utveckla den tekniska färdplanen och säkerställa att den överensstämmer med myndighetens färdplan
* Bygga upp och leda enheten Tekniska Kontoret som består av seniora arkitekter inom områdena system, infrastruktur, informationshantering, processhantering, AI
* Bygga och upprätthålla en högpresterande kultur, främja en miljö som prioriterar lagarbete, leverans och en enastående användarupplevelse.
* Säkerställa en robust, skalbar och säker arkitektur, inklusive beredskapsplanering och dataskydd.
* Hålla ett skarpt öga på framväxande teknologier, utvärdera deras relevans och potentiella värde för myndigheten.


**Vårt erbjudande**
 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid som kan komma att inledas med sex månaders provanställning. Placeringsorten är Solna eller enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder dig möjligheten att arbeta på en arbetsplats där vi värdesätter balans mellan arbete och privatliv. Du får tillgång till ett generöst semesteravtal, förtroendearbetstid samt möjlighet att arbeta på distans upp till 49 procent på årsbasis. Då Arbetsförmedlingen är en beredskapsmyndighet kan du komma att bli krigsplacerad i din tjänst. Mer om att jobba hos oss
   

  

 Säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan komma att genomföras innan anställningen påbörjas.
   

  

 Hos oss gör du verklig skillnad för individer och för samhället i stort.
   

  

**Grundläggande kvalifikationskrav**
* Flerårig aktuell erfarenhet av Chefskap med verksamhets- och personalansvar
* Relevant akademisk examen såsom t.ex. civilingenjör inom Datavetenskap, teknisk fysik eller teknisk matematik. Eller motsvarande erfarenhet förvärvad på annat sätt som arbetsgivaren bedömer som likvärdig och relevant
* Aktuell erfarenhet av att leda specialister och/eller chefer
* Aktuell erfarenhet av att leda en organisation i förändring


**Meriterande för tjänsten**
* Aktuell erfarenhet som CTO


 Som anställd hos oss förväntas du arbeta rättvist, opartiskt och med hög integritet, samt bidra till att upprätthålla och stärka förtroendet för vår myndighet. Mer om statliga värdegrunden
   

  

 Utöver dessa kvalifikationer har du personlig förmåga och fallenhet att arbeta i enlighet med Arbetsförmedlingens medarbetarskap:
   

  

 Medarbetare på Arbetsförmedlingen:
   

  

* Tar ansvar för sina arbetsprestationer och sitt bidrag till helheten
* Anpassar sig till förändring och oförutsedda händelser
* Tar initiativ till utveckling och bidrar till förbättring


**Chefer är medarbetare på Arbetsförmedlingen som dessutom:**
* Pekar ut riktning för sina medarbetare och följer upp prestationer
* Undanröjer hinder i vardagen och hanterar problem
* Skapar delaktighet i arbetet och främjar utveckling


**Personliga egenskaper som är framgångsrika för rollen:**
* Inspirera och leda ditt team med självförtroende.
* Hög nivå av ansvarighet och stor integritet.
* Ett nyfiket tänkesätt, särskilt om framväxande teknologier och olika discipliner.
* Proaktiv och resultatorienterad


**Ansökan**
 Låter det här som en tjänst för dig? Välkommen med din ansökan senast 2025 - 03 - 31.
   

  

 Bifoga ditt CV där du specificerar årtal, månad och arbetsuppgifter för varje anställning, samt intyg som styrker kraven om utbildning och/eller arbetslivserfarenhet i din ansökan.
   

  

 Det är viktigt att du besvarar urvalsfrågorna detaljerat och sanningsenligt, för att vi ska få en tydlig bild av din erfarenhet. Om efterfrågad information inte framgår riskerar du bli bortsållad i urvalet. Du behöver inte skicka in ett personligt brev.
   

  

 Under rekryteringsprocessen kan urvalstester förekomma. Vi kommer att hålla dig informerad genom hela rekryteringsprocessen. Mer om vår rekryteringsprocess.
   

  

 Har du skyddade personuppgifter kontaktar du den rekryteringspartner som finns namngiven i annonsen så får du hjälp med att skicka in din ansökan.
   

  

*I denna rekrytering samarbetar vi med Experis. Vid frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta rekryteringskonsult Carina Eyoma, carina.eyoma@se.experis.com, 073-0862275* 
 .
   

  

 Vi arbetar aktivt för att vara en myndighet fri från diskriminering. Det är viktigt för oss att all kompetens tas tillvara och vi välkomnar alla sökande. Vi ser positivt på om du har kunskaper i något av våra nationella minoritetsspråk.
   

  

**Välkommen till jobbet som får Sverige i arbete! Här arbetar du på regeringens uppdrag för en arbetsmarknad som hjälper människor framåt. Vi frigör möjligheter så att arbetssökande hittar sysselsättning och arbetsgivare sin nästa medarbetare. För att nå målet behöver vi samarbeta, i myndigheten men också med olika externa aktörer i hela landet. Tillsammans driver vi förändring, utvecklar nya arbetssätt och skapar lösningar som gör att Sverige kan fortsätta framåt.**
 Mer om vår organisation och vårt uppdrag.

title: Solution Architect - Fulfillment Area (SAP)
description:
**Job Description**
**This is opportunity to join team of Solution Architects working on cutting edge retail solutions within our company within several different areas from product creation, through logistics, to sales in store or online.**
 As a Solution Architect for Portfolio Brands, you will work with stakeholders in different Brands in the Group and play a critical role in driving growth, profitability, and scalability across both digital and retail domains. This position requires a strategic thinker with a deep understanding of technology solutions and their application in the fashion retail industry.
   

  

 In this role as Solution Architect, you will be responsible for translating business and tech requirements into architecture blueprints. You will also conduct thorough analysis of existing solutions, identify gaps, and recommend improvements. To deliver in this role you will have to evaluate the architecture holistically, use deep technical expertise to understand the business impact of technical components, and give recommendations and guidelines for teams implementing solutions.
   

  

 You want work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and open to change. You show commitment and ownership and demonstrate attention to detail and accuracy, architectural governance and standards. Effective team player that can express the importance of technical concepts and quality, emerging technologies, ideas, feelings, opinions, and conclusions to peers and people with an only limited technical background and contribute positively to your team environment.
   

  

 We are looking for a Solution Architect for
 ***Fulfillment***
 Area.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Define a shared technical and architectural vision focused on creating technical alignment for the full solution rather than concerns for specific components.
* Review, analyze, develop and facilitate stakeholder understanding of business and technology implication of future direction, roadmaps and implementation plans.
* Create architectural design to guide and contextualize solution development across initiatives that aligns with business and IT goals.
* Provide necessary leadership, analysis and design tasks related to the development of technology solutions to ensure that solutions meet business needs and align with architectural governance and standards.
* Identify interdependencies and use ‘holistic thinking’ to ensure the cross-team perspective. Provide consulting support around solution architecture to teams to ensure a product is aligned with the overall enterprise architecture.
* Translate business and technical requirements into architectural blueprints and document all solution architecture design and analysis.
* Evaluate and drive continuous improvement, reducing technical debt, and enhancing end-to-end business value.
* Work continuously with incorporating broader aspects such as overall product costs/revenue, data privacy & sovereignty, business continuity, information security, integration with other systems, etc.
* Facilitate best practice sharing and teach architecture thinking to engineering and product community.
* Take ownership and responsibility of current solutions and flows and ensure secure and stable operations with good focus on resolving recurring problems to the root cause.


**Qualifications**
* Minimum of 5 years of experience in IT with experience in Solution architecture in the retail or fashion industry.
* Proven track record in designing and implementing scalable solutions in digital and retail environments.
* Experience in working with SAP, Salesforce etc.
* Experience in working in complex landscape with a combination of cloud solution and Enterprise Applications such as SAP.
* Strong understanding of cloud computing, microservices architecture, APIs, and integration frameworks.
* Ability to understand and visualize concepts that are not yet concrete, and use your problem-solving skills, strong analytic ability, creativity and customer and business drive to find a solution.
* Ability to create both high-level and low-level design documentation and technical specification.
* Experience of planning and driving workshops with implementation teams, architects as well as business stakeholders.
* Ability to work with composability frameworks and support to define Packaged Business Capabilities (PBCs) to ensure scalable and modular architectural solutions.
* Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.


**Benefits**
**Additional Information**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

*In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.*
**Inclusion & Diversity**
*H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.*
*We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.*
**Company Description**
 H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way. Learn more about H&M here.

title: Solution Architect - GenAI
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Business Consulting and Services
description:
What makes Cognizant a unique place to work? The combination of rapid growth and an international and innovative environment! This is creating a lot of opportunities for people like YOU — people with an entrepreneurial spirit who want to make a difference in this world.
   

  

 At Cognizant, together with your colleagues from all around the world, you will collaborate on creating solutions for the world's leading companies and help them become more flexible, more innovative and successful. And this is your chance to be part of the success story: we are looking for a Solution Architect to join our AIA/Gen AI-Team.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are seeking a highly skilled technical expert to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will possess a deep understanding of Large Language Models (LLMs) and demonstrate proficiency in leading cloud platforms such as Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and Microsoft Azure. With a strong foundation in modern IT architectures, including APIs, containerization, and microservices, the candidate will be well-equipped to handle complex system integration patterns and IT risk management.
   

  

 In addition to technical prowess, we value individuals who can effectively manage stakeholders and foster collaboration between teams. The successful candidate will combine hands-on technical capabilities with excellent communication and interpersonal skills, ensuring seamless teamwork and project success.
   

  

 If you are passionate about leveraging cutting-edge technologies and thrive in a collaborative environment, we invite you to apply and become a key contributor to our innovative team.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Translator between business and tech/architecture.
* Facilitate PoC implementation.
* Provide technical guidance on scalable solution designs across domains and utilize existing infrastructure while managing IT risk.
* Provide guidance on technical feasibility, IT risk and cross-domain dependencies.
* Maintain an overview of overlapping requirements and opportunities for reuse across domains.
* Facilitate discussions between teams and knowledge sharing.
* Validate and assist on solution design (focusing on LLM integration).
* Contribute to the CoE’s artifacts repository on Orangesharing.

title: Executive Trainee
job_function: General Business, Management, and Project Management
company_industry: Entertainment Providers and Broadcast Media Production and Distribution
description:
**Are you a recent graduate with a thirst for success and an eagerness to dive into the world of business? If so, Allente, the Nordic TV Operator, wants you! We're on the lookout for ambitious, creative, and highly motivated individuals to join our dynamic team in Stockholm, Sweden.** 




  





**Who are we?** 




 Allente offers high-quality TV and streaming services via satellite and broadband to one million customers in Sweden, Norway, Denmark, and Finland. The company was founded in May 2020 after a merger between Canal Digital and Viasat Consumer, and has its headquarters in Stockholm and Oslo. The acting CEO is Mahmoud Mustapha, and in 2023, the company had a revenue of nearly 7 billion SEK. The company is owned 50/50 by Telenor Group and Viaplay Group.
 



  





  





**Key Responsibilities and Duties** 




 As a Management Trainee, you'll work alongside our Chief Executive Officer on an exciting range of projects. Your role will span various areas, including Brand/Marketing, New Business, Customer Development, and Product Portfolio. You'll take a helicopter perspective of the company, supporting communication and analysis to drive growth and optimization. Some of your responsibilities will include:
 



  




* Coordinating and planning for the Chief Executive Officer and the Allente management team.
* Leading efficiency or growth projects as a project manager.
* Organizing and participating in critical meetings to set the strategic direction for the commercial division.
* Preparing analytical and creative presentations.
* Supporting the Chief Executive Officer and his management team with practicalities.
* Bringing your own ideas and suggestions to the table.



  





  





**Who We Are Looking For?** 




 The ideal candidate is a recent graduate with a Bachelor's or Master's degree in business or economics.
 



  





  





**We seek someone who is:** 



* Available to start within a month
* Ambitious, structured, and result-oriented
* A team-player with strong communication skills
* Curious with a thirst for learning
* Brave and innovative
* Proficient in both English and Swedish



  





  





**What’s in it for YOU?** 




 You will join a company where we
 **#dare** 
 to think differently,
 **#care** 
 deeply for each other, and
 **#share** 
 knowledge. We foster a culture of accountability, curiosity, and collaboration, where everyone can make a positive impact across teams and locations.
 



  





  





**On top of that you will:** 



* Have a permanent position in one of the biggest providers of TV- and media services in the Nordics
* Get excellent opportunities for personal development in young, yet well-established company
* Get extra ‘Allente days’ off in addition to standard vacation days
* Work with a truly dedicated team and be a part of a community that is dedicated to making everyday life more entertaining!



  





  





**We respect your time,** 




 And therefore, we made sure that our application process is time-efficient and simple (we do not require any additional forms, questionnaires nor cover letter) - you can easily apply with your CV or even just your LinkedIn profile.
 



 -->> If you want to make a strong impression, you can do that by making a short video where you answer our questions:)
 



  





  





**Wanna make a difference? Submit your resume and let's embark on this exciting journey together! #WeCare #WeDare #WeShare #JoinAllente**

title: Specialistsäljare inom Hybrid Platforms
description:
Är du redo att ta steget och utmana dig själv både personligt och professionellt? Som specialistsäljare hos oss, får du chansen att inte bara hitta nya kunder, utan också utveckla och stärka relationerna med våra befintliga kunder. Tillsammans med ditt team blir du en strategisk rådgivare för våra kunder i deras digitala resa! Låter det spännande?
 



 Ta chansen och sök rollen som Specialistsäljare hos oss idag!
 



  





**Din roll på Atea** 




 Den här rollen handlar om att bygga och vårda relationer - med kunder inom både privat och offentlig sektor, internt på Atea och med våra fantastiska partners. Vi har ett otroligt nätverk av leverantörer och partners som inte bara samarbetar med oss, utan också erbjuder utbildningar för våra specialister. Arbetet består av många delar, vilket gör det både komplext, roligt och utmanande.
 



  





**Exempel på dina arbetsuppgifter är:** 



* Arbeta som avtalsansvarig hos våra kunder, vilket innebär uppföljning, hantering av lösningsförslag och avtalsfrågor samt förhandlingar
* Utmana och vägleda våra kunder till nya lösningar och tjänster som hjälper dem på sin digitala resa
* Hantera prissättning, kostnadskalkylering, juridiska frågor och upphandlingar



  





 Våra kunders investeringar i Hybrid Platform med tillhörande tjänster är viktigare än någonsin och är verksamhetskritiska som kräver hög service, rådgivning och support i världsklass. Just nu söker vi dig som vill jobba som specilistsäljare inom Hybrid Platform med fokus på att sälja, utveckla och förvalta våra kunders datacenter, server/lagring, nätverk och hybrid cloud.
 



  





**Vad vi söker hos dig** 




 Vi tror på dig och dina kompetenser, som är nyckeln till framgång i den här rollen! Vi ser att du trivs som en "Trusted Advisor" och har en stark drivkraft att ständigt lära dig nya saker. Du har ett proaktivt förhållningssätt och drivs av att hitta lösningar på problem, både självständigt och i grupp. Du är engagerad och självständig i ditt arbete, noggrann och alltid redo att gräva djupt för att möta kundens behov och krav. Du är en stjärna på att skapa relationer och ger alltid ett förtroendeingivande och trovärdigt intryck.
 



  





 För att lyckas i tjänsten som specialistsäljare ser vi att du har:
 


* Erfarenhet av försäljning inom B2B
* Flertalet års erfarenhet av arbete med försäljning
* Erfarenhet inom avtalshantering, svarar på upphandlingar samt förhandla
* Svenska och engelska språkkunskaper, flytande i både tal och skrift



  





**Meriterande:** 



* Kunskap och erfarenhet av någon av de andra stora datacenter/nätverkstillverkarna
* Erfarenhet av upphandlingar eller annan juridisk erfarenhet, gärna inom LOU
* Erfarenhet av tjänsteförsäljning
* Erfarenhet av Azure & Hybrid Cloud lösningar



  





**Vårt löfte till dig** 




 Hos oss får du vara med att bidra till ett smartare, effektivare och mer hållbart samhälle. Med fokus på utveckling, laganda och personligt ansvarstagande ser vi till att göra skillnad. Vi uppmuntrar och stöttar varandra, och tar vara på våra individuella förmågor, perspektiv och erfarenheter. Det är därför du är viktig för oss. För att du är du, för att du är nyfiken och för att du vill växa professionellt - och som människa. Tillsammans skapar vi laget som bygger Sverige med it.
 



  





**Kontakt & mer information** 




 Har du frågor om tjänsten är du varmt välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef, Maria Siewer, maria.siewer@atea.se och om du har frågor angående rekryteringsprocessen är du välkommen att kontakta TA Partner Molly Benner på molly.benner@atea.se. Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum, ansök därmed redan idag.
 



  





 Du kommer i vår rekryteringsprocess genomgå ett personlighet- och färdighetstest. Som en kvalitativ del i vår rekryteringsprocess genomgår slutkandidater även en bakgrundskontroll, detta för att öka kännedomen om dig som vår framtida medarbetare.
 



  





 Atea vill vara The Place To Be, den självklara platsen, för alla människor då vi värdesätter och jobbar aktivt med mångfald och inkludering.
 



  





**Vi ser fram emot din ansökan till oss!** 




**Följ oss i sociala medier**

title: Project Manager / Product Owner
description:
**Who we are** 




 Codepole is a fast-growing consulting company & venture enabler. We are experts in finance, product development, and app development working with large companies (Spotify, HBO Max, Swedbank, Tele2) as well as scale ups and start ups. In addition to our consulting services, we build and launch our own ventures together with our team members.
 



  





**Role Overview:** 




 We are expanding our team of consultants to work with our clients in Sweden and are looking for driven and ambitious people to join us. In this particular role you will be taking on assignments within the Project Manager & Product Owner fields.
 



  





**What you’ll do** 



* Work on interesting and challenging projects for our clients across Europe, ranging from a couple of months to up to a year. The projects involve acting either as 1) a Project Manager running an IT-related project for one of our clients or 2) a Product Owner for teams developing everything from back-end systems (API platforms, IAM solutions, etc.) to front-end applications and components.
* When not being on a project, build and improve the software for CodePole’s internal ventures, such as a business loan broker or a credit data provider
* Contribute to the development of CodePole in whatever way you can do it the best, be it sharing your knowledge, organizing professional speakers to run workshops for the team, taking part in our client calls, improving on our recruitment process, or planning our next team event



  





**Who you are** 



* You have a technical affinity and a good enough technical knowledge to participate in discussions within the development team, even if you do not know all the technical specificities
* You are open to work in both Project Manager and Product Owner roles
* You have great communication skills, being able to cooperate both with the tech and business teams
* You have the skills required to understand the needs of the business side and to translate these into technical requirements and implementation steps
* You are a driven person striving to improve things and enjoy getting things done
* You are fluent in Swedish and professional proficiency in English



  





**How we work** 




 We believe that it is key for our team members to grow their skill set, and that this is done by experiencing challenging technical projects and by learning from each other. The work is varied between time based projects for clients, team augmentation for clients, and our own ventures and products. This allows our team members to continuously develop as they get to experience different software, problems, and solutions. Our team members share their knowledge with each other on a daily basis, so we ensure that we learn as much as possible.
 



  





**What we offer** 



* Challenging and interesting assignments, internally and at our client’s across the world
* An environment that allows, encourages, and supports you in your professional development
* Competitive salary
* A lot of office fun :)

title: Portfolio Execution Lead in Core Technology
description:
**Job ID: 27205**
 Are you a self-driven, top performer and committed professional with high integrity looking for new challenges? Then we have the perfect role for you! We are looking for a Portfolio Execution Lead in one of our Service Domains within Core Technology. This is an opportunity for you to grow and be part of an ambitious journey to shape and deliver the future of Technology in the bank.
   

  

 In today’s world, change is the one thing you can count on. That’s where you come in. Working with dedicated colleagues in an exciting and inspiring environment, creating great solutions to meet the needs of our customers, and at the same time to meet the expectations that Nordea has towards its stakeholders. This means you’ll have many opportunities to learn and grow as you build your career with us.
   

  

**About This Opportunity**
 At Nordea, we’re deeply committed to deliver the financial solutions of tomorrow.
   

  

**What you’ll be doing:**
* Oversee and manage the Core Technology delivery for multiple Change initiatives within a portfolio to achieve successful business outcome. Initiatives can vary from medium to large complexity
* Be responsible for monitoring the change portfolio deliverables, managing risks and issues, ensuring we meet our Core Technology commitments
* Deliver on agreed objectives in a predictable and transparent manner and participate in change management initiatives
* Proactively coordinate internal dependencies between the Core Technology Service Domains and agree on external dependencies with external stakeholders
* Set and clarify expectations, share information and actively manage stakeholders to secure alignment, provide transparency and clear communications
* Governance reporting to the relevant Core Technology Steering and governance in a clear, professional manner
* Establish and maintain an overall portfolio culture and discipline, ensuring adherence to agreed Core Technology change delivery processes and portfolio project compliance


 The role is based in Helsinki, Oslo, Stockholm or Poland.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 Collaborator. Owner. Passionate. Courageous. Influencer. Thinker. Communicator. These are the values that guide us in being our best and that we imagine you share with us, as well as an ability to challenge, propose solutions, and assess risk.
   

  

**Your experience and background:**
* Proven delivery track record, delivering large to highly complex change programmes involving Infrastructure and platform development
* Analytical skills and ability to deal with complex and demanding issues
* Experience delivering change initiative both in Traditional and / or Agile methodology
* Good financial and resource management knowledge
* Proactively manage stakeholders and successfully deliver according to agreed scope & priorities, in a predictable and transparent manner
* Excellent English skills, both in speaking and in writing


 If this sounds like you, please get in touch!
   

  

**Next steps**
 Submit your application no later than 11/03/2025.
   

  

**We enable dreams and aspirations for a greater good.**
**We build relationships.** 
 We add a personal touch to everything we do – when advising our customers, collaborating with colleagues, and meeting our potential candidates.
   

  

**We learn and develop.** 
 We take pride in being experts and thinking ahead. We use our expertise to meet our customers’ needs, from the simplest to the most complex. We bring a growth mindset to our work that enables us to focus on a broader perspective in our daily challenges.
   

  

**We lead change.** 
 We are responsible and aware of the impact of our decisions, both for our customers and for our local and global communities. Mindful of our responsibility towards current and future generations, we have made sustainability an integrated part of our business strategy.
   

  

**We are Nordea.** 
 We have a 200-year history of supporting and growing the Nordic economies and our values are deeply rooted in these open, progressive and collaborative societies. As one of the biggest employers in the Nordics, Poland and Estonia, you have excellent opportunities to evolve, develop and move forward with us.
   

  

 Studies show that members of underrepresented communities don’t apply for jobs unless they tick all the qualification boxes. If this is part of why you hesitate to apply, we would like you to reconsider and give it a chance. Maybe your profile fits our needs much better than you think.
   

  

**Only for candidates in Finland:** 
 A security clearance will be performed for the person selected for this position.
   

  

**Only for candidates in Sweden:** 
 For union information, please contact Finansförbundet at finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACO at SacoNordea@nordea.com.
   

  

**Only for candidates in Poland:** 
 Please include permit for processing personal data in CV as following:
   

  

 In accordance with art. 6 (1) a and b. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‘GDPR’. I agree to have: my personal data, education and employment history proceeded for the purposes of current and future recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp.
   

  

 The administrator of your personal data is: Nordea Bank Abp operating in Poland through its Branch, address: Aleja Edwarda Rydza Śmiglego 20, 93-281 Łodź. Your personal data will be processed for the recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. You have a right to access your personal data, right to rectify and right to delete. Disclosing the personal data in the scope specified by the provisions of Polish Labour Code from 26 June 1974 and executive acts are mandatory. Providing personal data is necessary to conduct the recruitment processes. The request for the deletion of your personal data means resignation from further participation in recruitment processes and causes the immediate removal of your application. Detailed information concerning processing of your personal data can be found at: nordea.com/en/doc/nordea-privacy-policy-for-applicants.pdf
   

  

 We reserve the right to reply only to selected applications.

title: Strategy & Market Analyst
description:
**Why Join Us?** 




 At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.
 



  





 To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our solutions.
 



  





**About the Role:** 




 As a Strategy and Market Analyst, you will join our dynamic and fast-paced Commercial team that thrives on collaboration and innovation that focuses on
 **strategy development on behalf of the Group** 
 . You will
 **research** 
 and analyze global market trends, competitive landscapes, and customer behavior.
 



  





 Your findings and actionable insights will support strategic decision-making and help drive business growth. You will also have the opportunity to work closely with senior executives and cross-functional teams, gaining insights from various departments.
 



 If you are a strategic, results-oriented and analytical person with a passion in strategy,
 **market dynamics** 
 and business value creation, this is a great opportunity for you!
 



  





**In this role, you will:** 



* Develop market forecasts, predictive models, analytical frameworks and methods as needed to support strategic planning.
* Gather, analyze and interpret complex datasets on global market trends, customer behavior, and competitive landscape to identify patterns, trends, and insights.
* Create reports and presentations to communicate findings and provide actionable recommendations to stakeholders based on market analysis.
* Collaborate closely with marketing, sales, product development, finance, HR and M&A teams to provide data-driven insights.
* Stay updated on industry news, trends, and regulatory changes.
* Support strategy development and investor dialogues with insights.
* Perform various other duties assigned.



  





**Please note:** 
 This is a
 **hybrid** 
 role, 2-3 days from our office in Stockholm city. This role can include occasional project-based travel (3 times a year), which would be communicated in advance.
 



  





**What We're Looking For:** 




 We are looking for someone who has:
 


* Equivalent of bachelor’s degree in finance, economics, business or a related field. A master’s degree is a plus.
* Minimum of 5 years of experience in management consulting, investment banking, corporate finance, corporate strategy development or a related field.
* Project management experience from complex projects and/or small to medium sized teams.
* Advanced analytical skills with proficiency in financial modelling and valuation techniques.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint. Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present complex information clearly and concisely.
* Professional proficiency in verbal and written English.
* Advanced organizational skills with the ability to implement multiple projects simultaneously.



  





**What is next?** 




 You can submit your resume and/or LinkedIn profile
 **(in English)** 
 through our careers page and share your questions with us at mine.hacisalihoglu@tobiidynavox.com. We're looking forward to your application!
 



  





**Our Values:** 




 At Tobii Dynavox, our mission guides what we do, and our values guide us in how we do it. Across the organization, we are committed to being Collaborative, Considerate, Curious and Courageous. We build a trusting environment where every team member prioritizes our customers with empathy and insight. Bold ideas and learning lead to impactful solutions. Driven by curiosity, we continuously challenge the status quo to create meaningful, customer-focused solutions for our customers.
 



  





**What We Offer:** 




 At Tobii Dynavox, we believe in empowering individuals – including our employees - to reach their full potential. Here’s what makes us unique:
 


* Purpose-Driven Work: Join a company that transforms lives by giving a voice to those with communication challenges. Every day, your work makes a meaningful and concrete impact.
* “Yes, and...” Flexibility: Build a rewarding career AND enjoy time with loved ones. We offer flexible work options so you don’t have to choose between personal and professional goals.
* Growth and Development: Whether you’re advancing your skills or growing your career, we invest in your future with training, learning opportunities, and internal growth paths.
* Inclusive and Supportive Culture: Work in a collaborative, caring environment where diversity and individuality are valued. You’ll feel connected to both your team and our global community.
* A Global Leader with Heart: Be part of an innovative, forward-thinking company that combines experience and cutting-edge solutions with a mission to change lives.

title: Senior Research Fellow within innovation and digitalisation
description:
**Join Nordregio – A Leading Nordic Research Institute** 
  

  

 Nordregio is currently seeking Senior Research Fellows fluent in both a Nordic language and English to join our team. This position offers an opportunity to contribute to impactful research and analysis on key topics in regional development and planning. For these positions, we are interested in candidates with expertise and interest in the societal dimension of innovation and digitalization with specialisation in areas such as:
   

  

* Artificial Intelligence
* Inclusive digital transformation
* Digital divides
* Data privacy and ethics
* Twin transitions
* Governance and innovation processes


**Requirements** 
  

  

* A doctoral degree in a relevant discipline such as science and technology studies, geography, economics, innovation studies, political science, sociology, anthropology, or similar.
* At least two years of relevant experience in research or practice post-graduation.
* Motivation to develop new research perspectives, build research networks, and securing new funding.
* Strong analytical and methodological skills and the ability to take a creative approach to complex problems.
* Highly motivated with the ability to work independently, as well as the skills to work effectively in a cooperative research environment.
* Well-developed communication skills, including the ability to network and work collaboratively with a range of stakeholders and partner organisations.
* The geographic scope of your fields of interest includes in-depth knowledge of at least one Nordic country as well as a pan-European perspective.
* Ability and willingness to contribute to Nordregio’s commitment to fostering a supportive and equitable workplace.


 The applicant must be fluent in English as well as a Nordic language.
   

  

**What we offer** 
  

  

 The position starts as soon as possible - or subject to agreement. Nordregio offers contracts with a maximum length of four years. Subject to further agreement, the contract can be extended for up to four additional years. If you are currently employed by the State in a Nordic country, you are entitled to a leave of absence from your present position for the duration of your employment at Nordregio according to the agreement “Avtale om rettstilling for samnordiske institusjoner og deres ansatte”. Candidates relocating from another Nordic country to Sweden are offered a relocation package as well as a monthly salary addition. For our employees to perform at a high level, we support, in various ways, the employee’s own responsibility and initiative to find a balance between work and private life. Examples of support include generous health benefits, remote work according to individual agreements, opportunities for peer-to-peer learning, and encouraging social gatherings.
   

  

**Why Nordregio?** 
  

  

 Nordregio is an international research centre for regional development and planning. We conduct solution-oriented and applied research, addressing current issues from both an academic perspective and from the viewpoint of policymakers and practitioners. Nordregio participates in European, Nordic and national research programs and carries out commissioned projects for different levels of government. We conduct case-studies in different regions, perform territorial analyses on a transnational and pan-European level, and undertake evaluations of various European and national programs.
   

  

 We are a team of multidisciplinary, international people and our office is situated in attractive surroundings at Skeppsholmen in the heart of Stockholm, Sweden. The institute was established in 1997 by the Nordic Council of Ministers and is built on 50 years of Nordic collaboration.
   

  

 Working at Nordregio provides you with the opportunity to become part of a truly international research environment. We offer significant career development potential in terms of enhancing your international network of contacts in both policy and academic fields, as well as an extensive experience with project management. You will also have rich opportunities to collaborate with regional and municipal stakeholders in the Nordic countries.
   

  

**Application**
 Application deadline:
 
 We look forward to your application, including CV and personal letter in English no later than
 **March 28, 2025** 
 .
   

  

 How to apply: Click on "
 **ansök här** 
 " at the bottom of the page. When you are redirected to the "
 **integritetspolicy** 
 " (privacy policy) page, check the box to accept it. On the next page regarding "
 **offentlighetsregler** 
 " (publicity rules) click on "
 **fortsätt** 
 " to proceed to your application.
   

  

 We kindly request applicants to not submit their application via e-mail.
   

  

**Contact:**
 Research Director Thomas Niedomysl (Thomas.Niedomysl@nordregio.org or phone + 46 790633695)
   

  

 Local union representative Hilma Salonen (Hilma.Salonen@nordregio.org or phone + 46 761 695055)
   

  

 For further information about Nordregio, see www.nordregio.org

title: Operativ inköpare
description:
Vill du vara med och göra skillnad där insatserna är som störst? Då kan Mildef vara arbetsplatsen för dig. MilDef verkar på en global marknad med världsledande taktiska IT-lösningar. Vi skräddarsyr IT-produkter och system gjorda för att prestera under de tuffaste av förhållanden.
   

  

 Mildef vill nu utöka sitt starka team inom inköp i Rosersberg. Vi arbetar främst mot försvarssektorn och är ramavtalspartner mot FMV och Försvarsmakten. Du erbjuds en intressant och utvecklande roll i ett branschledande bolag som är framtidsorienterat, innovativt och inne i en mycket spännande tillväxtfas.
   

  

**Din nya utmaning**
 Som inköpare kommer du stötta våra projekt i alla typer av inköpsfrågor och har ett stort mått av integritet, nyfikenhet och stark drivkraft för att fylla denna roll.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**
* Offerthantering
* Inköp
* Bevaka samt säkerställa leveranser
* Fakturahantering
* Leverantörshantering


**Det här bidrar du med**
* Du arbetar förmodligen idag som inköpare och har gjort ett par år.
* Du har ett visst intresse av teknik.
* Du förstår och tillämpar affärsmässiga principer och fokuserar på kostnader, intäkter och effektivitet.
* Du har förmågan att se till helheten och kan därmed ta hänsyn till det större perspektivet. Du förstår din roll men agerar alltid i enlighet med vad som är bäst för hela verksamheten.
* Du skall ha förmåga att arbeta självständigt, vara duktig på att kommunicera och kunna driva frågor framåt i ditt dagliga arbete.
* Du sprider glädje och bidrar till en positiv arbetsmiljö.


 Våra uppdrag kräver att du måste vara svensk medborgare och klarar vår säkerhetsprövning. Koncernspråket är engelska vilket gör att det är viktigt att du skriver och pratar engelska obehindrat.
   

  

 Resor i tjänsten kan förekomma.
   

  

**Varför MilDef?**
 På MilDef får du arbeta i en engagerad och stöttande miljö där dina idéer och insatser värdesätts. Du kommer att ha möjligheter till kontinuerligt lärande och utveckling samt arbeta i en teamorienterad miljö som främjar innovation och samarbete.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder dig**
* En engagerande och utvecklande roll i ett ledande företag.
* Möjlighet att arbeta med projekt som bidrar till nationell säkerhet och försvar.
* En samarbetsvillig och stöttande arbetsmiljö med engagerade kollegor.
* Kollektivavtal Teknikföretagen
* Friskvårdsbidrag
* Regelbundna hälsoundersökningar
* Happiness team som ordnar roliga aktiviteter


**Ansökan**
 Om du är redo för en ny utmaning och vill bli en del av vårt framgångsrika team, skicka din ansökan så fort som möjligt dåvi jobbar med löpande urval. Sista ansökningsdag är 2025-03-31.
   

  

 Vi ser gärna kvinnliga sökanden för att stärka mångfalden i teamet.
   

  

 Läs mer om oss på MilDef.com.
   

  

 För information om tjänsten, kontakta gärna Thomas Holmudd, Purchasing manager, på thomas.holmudd@mildef.com.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

***MilDef - WE ARMOR IT.***
*MilDef is a global systems integrator and full-spectrum provider specializing in rugged IT for military, government and critical infrastructure sectors. MilDef provides hardware, software, and services that shield and protect critical information streams and systems, when and where the stakes are the highest. MilDef’s products are sold to more than 200 customers through companies in Sweden, Norway, Finland, Denmark, United Kingdom, Germany, Switzerland, the United States and Australia, and through partner networks in more than 40 countries. MilDef was founded in 1997 and is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm since 2021.*
**Vi undanber oss kontakt från annonserings- och/eller rekryteringssäljare.**

title: Sales Advisor 30h - Summer substitute
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU’LL DO**
 As a Sales Advisor at H&M, you’ll play a key role in creating an outstanding customer experience. You’ll welcome customers, guide them through your store, and support them in finding what they need while showcasing our products. Acting in line with our values, you’ll contribute to both your own success and the success of the company.
   

  

 You will:
   

  

* Share your fashion and product knowledge to help customers make informed choices.
* Collaborate with your team to deliver exceptional service at every step of the customer journey.
* Ensure the sales floor and back of house are well-stocked, organized, and inviting.
* Support with opening and closing of the store.
* Represent yourself and the brand positively during all customer interactions.


**Who You’ll Work With**
 Our stores are the heart of our company, where customers experience our brand firsthand. As part of the dynamic Store Team, every role—from Sales Advisors, Department Managers, Store Managers and Visual Merchandisers to Assistant Store Managers, Cash Office Responsible, and Delivery Responsible in larger stores—contributes to creating an inspiring and welcoming environment. You’ll also connect with the wider Area Team, collaborating across stores to share insights and drive success together. Alongside your team, you'll play a vital role in helping customers feel confident and express their individuality with the latest trends and timeless styles. By building meaningful connections with customers in our stores, we make fashion accessible and sustainable for all.
   

  

**Who You Are**
*We are looking for people with…*
* Experience in customer service within fashion, retail, or similar fields.


*And people who are…*
* Passionate about fashion and delivering an exceptional in-store experience while promoting our products and driving sales.
* Thriving in collaborative and dynamic environments.
* Communicative, creative, curious to work with store technology, with a strong eagerness to learn and develop.
* Flexible and action oriented.


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

* All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online.
* In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.


**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 This is a temporary position for
 **3 months during summer offering 30 hours per week** 
 with start in May or by agreement.
 **This position is based in Haninge** 
 and you should be able to work during store opening hours. Basic language skills in Swedish or English is needed.
   

  

 We have an ongoing selection, so the position may be filled before the application deadline, so send in your application today!
 **The last application date is 19/3.**
 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

* Store roles assessment:


*To manage the high volume of applications for the Sales Advisor role, we use an online assessment method for skills-based recruitment within some of our stores. You will need to complete it as part of the application and screening process. Your responses will be scored by an assessment tool that applies predefined criteria set by H&M Group.*
*After completing the assessment, you’ll have the opportunity to share feedback and ask questions. If you experience any difficulties or prefer an alternative assessment method, please contact* 
*recruitment\_support@hm.com* 
*. Choosing an alternative will not impact on your application.*
*For more information on how we process your personal data, please see our Privacy Notice.*
* We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: Software Solutions Sales Exec - Nordics
description:
**Remote Work: Hybrid**
**Overview:**
 At Zebra, we are a community of innovators who come together to create new ways of working to make everyday life better. United by curiosity and care, we develop dynamic solutions that anticipate our customer’s and partner’s needs and solve their challenges.
   

  

 Being a part of Zebra Nation means being seen, heard, valued, and respected. Drawing from our diverse perspectives, we collaborate to deliver on our purpose. Here you are a part of a team pushing boundaries to redefine the work of tomorrow for organizations, their employees, and those they serve.
   

  

 You have opportunities to learn and lead at a forward-thinking company, defining your path to a fulfilling career while channeling your skills toward causes that you care about – locally and globally. We’ve only begun reimaging the future – for our people, our customers, and the world.
   

  

 Let’s create tomorrow together.
   

  

**This Solutions Sales role is part of the Software Solutions Sales Team. This team is the focal point for driving our Strategic Solutions into our key customers mainly in Retail vertical.**
 This role is responsible for achieving sales success and market penetration to deliver growth. Selling directly to end-users and via channels, this position will focus on new business sales within their assigned accounts in Nordics territory.
   

  

**This role requires knowledge of Danish and Swedish languages and ability to travel across Nordics region.**
**Responsibilities:**
* Responsible for developing and maintaining a healthy pipeline of new business opportunities to meet annual targets and defined objectives
* Leading all aspects of the sales cycle in your target accounts. This includes solution development, deal term negotiation, and contract closing process
* Being an expert in all things ZPA (Zebra Prescriptive Analytics) and Reflexis Solutions for your Accounts/Region/Territory
* Collaborating with internal teams to deliver 100% customer satisfaction, improving opportunities for additional business growth
* Meet and exceed individual quotas for contracts and revenue by closing multi-year cloud contracts
* Experience should include closing large, enterprise-wide annual recurring revenue contracts (ARR)
* Understanding Zebra’s unique value propositions and how our solutions have delivered value for our customers
* Identifying, reaching and influencing key decision makers and all influencers and stakeholders within targeted retail prospects
* Building a consistently producing territory by taking targeted retailers from suspect to prospect to opportunity to customer to long-term year-over-year client
* Being in the field in front of prospects on a weekly basis
* Diligently seeking to align retailer priorities with Zebra solution outcomes and move projects to closure in a timely manner via a strong value selling orientation
* Holding prospects accountable to their part in moving forward to realize the created vision
* Work in a collaborative team-based selling model with other Zebra sales reps, Business Development Reps, Solution Consultants, Value Engineers, Executives, Partners, Marketing and Customer Success
* Maintain current knowledge of the company’s solutions, industry compelling events, and competitive differentiators while making every interaction with a retailer world class
* Be a challenger – understand target client issues, needs and goals, and proactively educate and bring solutions to each discussion to deliver outcomes they desire


**Qualifications:**
* 8+ years Software Sales experience, B2B SaaS solutions sales
* Experienced in selling large ticket enterprise software product into Tier-1 customers
* Proficient knowledge of Swedish and Danish language
* Desire to seek new business -penetrate non-customer accounts and to create a need where it may not exist
* Ability to act as partner to C-level executives and in the field. Ability to develop relationships and closing opportunities with leading brands
* Able to evidence a consistent track record of selling high value multi-year recurring SaaS transactions, demonstrating a tenacious and curious personality to get to the root of customer expectation and needs.
* Comfortable and skilled in virtual selling (as clients require in these times)
* Success selling high dollar multi-year deals with 6-12 months sales cycles
* Technical aptitude and strong desire to understand how our software empowers retailers
* Ability to solve complex problems which may require engagement across diverse client stakeholder needs at the C-level
* Ability to work in team - building business case for change, determines and assembles the appropriate team to close deals
* Willing and able to cover a large territory, travel weekly, and sell in person, not phone and email only
* Travel Requirements (as a % of time): 50-75% travel


**Benefits:**
* 30 days of vacation
* Up to 32 hours paid time off per year to volunteer with a charity of your choice
* Reward & Recognition scheme - earn points to spend online
* Training and personal development in soft skills and hard skills, access to our internal learning portal and internal career opportunities within Zebra departments
* Yearly salary increases according to individual performance
* Employee referral bonus for bringing New Talent to Zebra
* Wellness Allowance
* Healthcare insurance
* Pension Plan and Life Insurance
* Access to an innovative online learning platform
* Employee Assistance Program


 To protect candidates from falling victim to online fraudulent activity involving fake job postings and employment offers, please be aware our recruiters will always connect with you via @zebra.com email accounts. Applications are only accepted through our applicant tracking system and only accept personal identifying information through that system. Our Talent Acquisition team will not ask for you to provide personal identifying information via e-mail or outside of the system. If you are a victim of identity theft contact your local police department.

title: M&A and Integrations Manager
description:
**Why Join Us?** 




 At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.
 



  





 To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our solutions.
 



  





**About the Role:** 




 As a
 **Mergers and Acquisitions (M&A) and Integrations Manager** 
 , you will join our dynamic and fast-paced Commercial team that thrives on collaboration and innovation. You will identify, assess, and execute global M&A opportunities and facilitate the integration of newly acquired companies.
 



 This role combines both strategic aspects of M&A and operational task of introducing acquisitions to Dynavox Group’s culture and way of working. In addition, you will have the opportunity to collaborate with senior executives and cross-functional teams, gaining insights from various departments.
 



  





 If you are a
 **people-centric** 
 , result-oriented, curious and analytical M&A professional with a passion in
 **integrations** 
 , this is a great opportunity for you!
 



  





**In this role, you will:** 



* Conduct comprehensive market research to identify interesting acquisition targets globally.
* Analyze financial statements, business models, and market conditions to evaluate potential M&A targets.
* Develop detailed financial models and valuation analyses to support M&A transactions, including negotiations and all parts of transaction.
* Prepare and present investment memoranda, due diligence reports, and strategic recommendations to senior management.
* Drive post-merger integration activities and track the performance of acquired companies.
* Collaborate cross-functionally to ensure seamless acquisition and integration of acquired entities.
* Perform various other duties assigned.



  





**Please note:** 
 This is a
 **hybrid** 
 role with flexible working hours,
 **2-3 days** 
 from our office in Stockholm city. This role can include occasional project-based travel
 **(5-7 times a year** 
 ) to visit our global offices and engage with potential M&A targets or other industry stakeholders. Business travels will be communicated in advance.
 



  





**What We're Looking For:** 




 We are looking for someone who has:
 


* Equivalent of bachelor’s degree in finance, economics, business or a related field. A master’s degree or professional certification (e.g., CFA, CPA) is a plus.
* Minimum of 5 years of experience in management consulting, M&A, investment banking, corporate finance transaction or a related field with exposure to M&A process, documentation and transaction.
* Project management experience from complex projects and/or small to medium sized teams.
* Advanced analytical skills with proficiency in financial modelling and valuation techniques.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint. Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present complex information clearly and concisely.
* Professional proficiency in verbal and written English.
* Advanced organizational skills with the ability to manage and execute multiple projects simultaneously.



  





**What is next?** 




 You can submit your resume and/or LinkedIn profile (in English only) through our careers page and share your questions with us at mine.hacisalihoglu@tobiidynavox.com. We're looking forward to your application!
 



  





**Our Values:** 




 At Tobii Dynavox, our mission guides what we do, and our values guide us in how we do it. Across the organization, we are committed to being Collaborative, Considerate, Curious and Courageous. We build a trusting environment where every team member prioritizes our customers with empathy and insight. Bold ideas and learning lead to impactful solutions. Driven by curiosity, we continuously challenge the status quo to create meaningful, customer-focused solutions for our customers.
 



  





**What We Offer:** 




 At Tobii Dynavox, we believe in empowering individuals – including our employees - to reach their full potential. Here’s what makes us unique:
 


* Purpose-Driven Work: Join a company that transforms lives by giving a voice to those with communication challenges. Every day, your work makes a meaningful and concrete impact.
* “Yes, and...” Flexibility: Build a rewarding career AND enjoy time with loved ones. We offer flexible work options so you don’t have to choose between personal and professional goals.
* Growth and Development: Whether you’re advancing your skills or growing your career, we invest in your future with training, learning opportunities, and internal growth paths.
* Inclusive and Supportive Culture: Work in a collaborative, caring environment where diversity and individuality are valued. You’ll feel connected to both your team and our global community.
* A Global Leader with Heart: Be part of an innovative, forward-thinking company that combines experience and cutting-edge solutions with a mission to change lives.

title: Sales Account Executive (all genders) - Stockholm
description:
**”Accelerating business to improve the lives of people”. This is our purpose statement and encapsulates what we enthusiastically do every day. We integrate our customers’ IT systems to make sure that the right data is at the right place at the right time when they digitalize their processes. Companies need their systems to talk to each other to ensure that cars roll off the factory line, that everyone receives their payments on time, and that you can buy what you need from a supermarket.**
**Our success story began in 1986, when we helped the German automotive industry to digitalize their paper-based supply chains. Today, SEEBURGER is a leading global B2B software provider with more than 1,000 #businessaccelerators in 15 countries worldwide and over 10,000 satisfied customers that rely on our innovative solutions.**
**The Position**
 We are searching for a dynamic and strategic Sales Account Executive to drive growth and close high-value deals. This role is pivotal in expanding our presence across the Nordics and offers significant influence in shaping the regional sales strategy.
   

  

**Location:** 
 Ideally based in Stockholm, Sweden, reporting to the Northern European Head of Sales.
   

  

 This position requires an experienced sales professional who thrives in complex, long-cycle sales processes and excels at negotiating with C-level executives, product owners, and business leaders. You will have the unique opportunity to influence and develop the market while working collaboratively within a growing and entrepreneurial team environment.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities**
* Develop and execute a strategic sales plan to acquire new named accounts and expand existing business relationships.
* Engage with C-level executives and key decision-makers to build trust and drive high-value negotiations.
* Navigate long sales cycles (3-12 months) with a solution-oriented sales approach, ensuring a focus on value-driven discussions.
* Work closely with internal stakeholders, including presales, business development, and technical teams, to structure compelling solutions.
* Lead complex sales processes, including contract negotiations and procurement discussions.
* Establish SEEBURGER as a trusted partner by understanding customer pain points and aligning our integration solutions to their strategic needs.
* Communicate the value of SEEBURGER’s B2B/EDI, API integration, MFT, and cloud-based solutions, ensuring clients understand how these technologies address their business challenges.
* Collaborate with global sales and marketing teams to optimize outreach and lead generation.


**Your Profile**
* Several years of experience in B2B enterprise sales, preferably within software, cloud solutions, or business integration services.
* Proven track record in closing large, complex enterprise deals and working with C-level stakeholders.
* Strong negotiation and consultative selling skills, with the ability to drive deals through extended sales cycles.
* Ability to balance a hunter mentality with the patience required for strategic, long-term sales.
* Entrepreneurial mindset with a passion for building and shaping a growing team, market and organisation.
* Excellent communication skills in English and Swedish.
* Familiarity with CRM tools such as Microsoft Dynamics is beneficial.
* Understanding of business integration technologies such as B2B/EDI, API management, cloud integration, and managed file transfer (MFT) is a plus.
* Experience selling to industries such as Automotive, retail, logistics, finance, and manufacturing is a plus.


**Why Join SEEBURGER?**
* Opportunity to shape and influence the Nordic market within a fast-growing, internationally recognized integration leader.
* A high-impact role where you can directly contribute to revenue growth and market expansion.
* Competitive compensation, including a strong commission structure and incentives.
* A collaborative and entrepreneurial team environment, working closely with senior leadership.
* The chance to work with some of the largest international brands and enterprise clients.


 If you are a results-driven enterprise sales professional with a passion for high-stakes negotiations and long-term business growth, we encourage you to apply!
   

  

**Contact Recruiting**
**Nina Muckenfuß**
**recruiting@seeburger.com**
**LinkedIn - XING**
**Benefit from being part of a globally renowned company that is driving digitalisation forward. We continue to grow - and so can you! It is important to us that you can fully utilise your talents and strengths and go your own way, regardless of whether you are aiming for a specialist or management career. With our expertise and growth in a future-oriented industry, we offer a wide range of opportunities and secure jobs. At SEEBURGER, we value the supportive atmosphere and family environment. #StrongerTogether is one of our corporate values and characterises the way we live together.**
**Sounds exciting? Become a #Businessaccelerator today!**

title: Rekryterare
description:
Om du kliver in i ett rum och direkt börjar förstå sammanhang, om du har drivet att bygga något från grunden och en skarp känsla för människor – då har vi rollen för dig! Zcelero, ett snabbväxande IT-konsultföretag i framkant av digital innovation, söker en professionell och initiativrik rekryterare till kontoret i Stockholm. Här bygger vi bolag – snabbt, smart och strategiskt. Vill du med? Ja, vi misstänkte väl det.
 



  





**I rollen kommer du att:** 



* Från dag ett: ta initiativ, läsa av behov och sätta i gång!
* Bygga rekryteringsstrategier som attraherar branschens skarpaste IT-konsulter.
* Identifiera, engagera och rekrytera talanger via LinkedIn, nätverk och direkta kontakter.
* Samarbeta med ledning och affärsansvariga för att förstå behoven och leverera rätt kompetens.
* Ständigt utveckla och förbättra rekryteringsprocessen – vi vill framåt!



  





**Vi söker dig som...** 




 … är en energigivande och professionell rekryterare som kan anpassa dig efter olika personligheter och sammanhang. Du har en naturlig känsla för människor, vet när du ska vara pådrivande och när du ska lyssna. Du ställer inte bara frågor – du söker aktivt svar och omsätter dem direkt i handling. Du hittar nya vägar och söker även i svår terräng fram en gång, visst läste du också framgång?
 



  





**För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har:** 



* Erfarenhet av att driva rekryteringsprocesser självständigt
* En naturlig fallenhet för att nätverka och skapa relationer
* Erfarenhet av LinkedIn Recruiter och andra search-verktyg
* Flytande svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift



  





**🎯 Meriterande om du även har:** 



* Erfarenhet av IT-rekrytering
* Bakgrund inom försäljning eller affärsutveckling



  





**Varför Zcelero?** 




 Vi erbjuder en plats i ett bolag där innovation och utveckling är i fokus. Här får du frihet att skapa, resurser att lyckas och en arbetskultur där vi bygger något större – tillsammans.
