title: Inside Sales Specialist - Cloud
description:
**Why Choose TD SYNNEX:**
  

  

As a **Fortune 500 global corporation**, operating in over 100 countries, TD SYNNEX values its diverse workforce of 22,000 employees. As the biggest IT distributor in the world, our mission is to provide top-notch technology solutions, empowering businesses and individuals to navigate the digital world safely and efficiently.  

  

**About the role:**
  

  

As an **Inside Sales Specialist,** you will join the sales team **within Cloud**. You'll build Excellent customer and vendor sales relationships through proactive engagement and demonstrable specialist product knowledge under supervision.
  

  

**What you'll do:**
  

* Generate new business opportunities by planning outbound calls to customers and can have a general conversation around a solution/product area
* Achieve monthly/quarterly Revenue and Margin targets
* Proactively develop relationships with key internal and external contacts
* Drives sales of specific products/ vendors if specific knowledge is required
* Provides accurate and timely quotations
* Generate and own a pipeline of deals in TD SYNNEX's CRM system, which is regularly reviewed and updated and ensure active closure of opportunities
* Manage customer backorder expectations and reporting
* Ensure CRM system is well maintained and provides correct customer information
* Provide, sell and negotiate product information, pricing, special offers and promotions

  

**What we're kindly looking for:**
  

* 1-2 years of experience in Sales.
* Fluent in English and Swedish.
* Numerate with good attention to detail
* Excellent telephone manner
* Priority management and planning skills
* Strive to achieve set targets

  

**What We Offer:**
  

  

We provide competitive compensation with **annual salary reviews.**  

  

**Hybrid work** - (3 days at the office, 2 days at home)  

  

We value continuous learning and provide a clear progression plan.  

  

We provide **comprehensive benefits** including **health insurance**, paid leave, retirement plans, and more.  

  

#LI-LT1  

  

#LI-HYBRID  

  

**Key Skills**  

  

**What's In It For You?**  

* **Elective Benefits:** Our programs are tailored to your country to best accommodate your lifestyle.
* **Grow Your Career:** Accelerate your path to success (and keep up with the future) with formal programs on leadership and professional development, and many more on-demand courses.
* **Elevate Your Personal Well-Being:** Boost your financial, physical, and mental well-being through seminars, events, and our global Life Empowerment Assistance Program.
* **Diversity, Equity & Inclusion:** It's not just a phrase to us; valuing every voice is how we succeed. Join us in celebrating our global diversity through inclusive education, meaningful peer-to-peer conversations, and equitable growth and development opportunities.
* **Make the Most of our Global Organization**: Network with other new co-workers within your first 30 days through our onboarding program.
* **Connect with Your Community:** Participate in internal, peer-led inclusive communities and activities, including business resource groups, local volunteering events, and more environmental and social initiatives.

  

**Don't meet every single requirement? Apply anyway.**  

  

At TD SYNNEX, we're proud to be recognized as a great place to work and a leader in the promotion and practice of diversity, equity and inclusion. If you're excited about working for our company and believe you're a good fit for this role, we encourage you to apply. You may be exactly the person we're looking for!

title: System Architect
description:
We develop and manufacture turnkey energy storage solutions, based on lithium-ion battery technology. Our goal is to engineer technology that both stores and optimizes energy as we shift towards more efficient energy usage and renewable energy sources on a global scale. You’ll have the opportunity to work with exceptional engineers, scientists, developers and more to pave the way for the next big leap in the energy industry through our battery energy storage and optimization systems.
  
**Location:** Stockholm
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

Contribute as a system architect in all phases of development.
  
Leverage your broad and deep knowledge of both hardware and software to ensure seamless system integration.
  
Define requirements to ensure hardware, firmware and cloud solutions are seamlessly integrated into a well-functioning architecture.
  
Drive the system architecture.
  
Create system descriptions, test requirements and manage certification strategies.
  
Create, maintaine and supervice the different system architectures within Polarium including, Hardware, Software, Cloud infrastructure.
  
Participate foras that including affecting decisions.
  
  

**Qualifications and experience:**  

A minimum of 5 years of documented experience in complex system design, including both hardware and software.
  
Proficiency in system architecture, firmware, and cloud solutions.
  
Experience in cyber security and its regulatory requirements.
  
Confidence in shifting from detailed analysis to a holistic perspective and clearly communicating concepts to engage the team.
  
Excellent communication skills with the ability to manage external contacts effectively.
  
A proactive, innovative problem-solving mindset and the ability to work both independently and as part of a team.
  
Fluency in English (both oral and written).
  
Occasional travel is a part of this role
  
  

We offer
  
Bonus system
  
Wellness contribution
  
Pension
  
  

Kindly submit your application through the provided apply button in the advertisement on our careers page, as we are unable to accept any applications via email in compliance with the GDPR regulations.
  
At Polarium, creating change in the energy industry starts with our team. We believe a diverse workplace brings creativity, innovation and better represents our customers, and the many communities they serve, around the world. A positive work-life balance is what supercharges our teamwork and a sustainable personal journey throughout our careers.
  
Since Polarium launched in 2015, we’ve been on a mission to redesign the energy industry. We’re unlocking the massive potential of energy storage systems through our wide range of intelligent and digital services. Our passion for solving challenges is what drives our next generation of premium energy storage products in use on all continents and in all climate zones. Today, we power businesses, optimize energy usage, and reduce carbon dioxide emissions to create a cleaner future in energy.
  
We look forward to receiving your application!

title: Delivery Executive - Practice Head
description:
As Delivery Executive, you will lead one or more of Zafin’s client relationships, technology innovation with responsibility for client engagement, end-to-end delivery, and customer success.
  
The role reports to the Chief Customer Officer.
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

As Delivery Executive, lead end-to-end corporate and institutional pricing & billing program delivery, delivering to client expectations, while managing cost, scope, schedule.
  
Strengthen existing client relationships and build new relationships to drive platform adoption, enable growth and elevate the Zafin brand.
  
Drive year-to-year revenue growth, identifying/developing new opportunities and teaming with sales as appropriate.
  
Communicate with clients at multiple levels, including senior stakeholders.
  
Partner with stakeholders within the Zafin team, including Product, Cloud, and Sales.
  
Contribute to building the Zafin business in the region, by contributing industry eminence and domain expertise to sales pursuits.
  
Collaborate with client & internal IT teams – Act as a bridge between business and technology teams to drive platform adoption and innovation.
  
Ensure security & compliance – Align implementations with industry regulations, mitigate IT risks, and support business continuity.
  
Technology innovation – Evaluate emerging technologies for business growth.
  
Technical leadership - Provide technical leadership in delivering enterprise-level banking software solutions, ensuring system scalability, performance, and security.
  
  

**Requirements:**  

Minimum of 7–10 years in banking or financial services with a focus on corporate and institutional clients.
  
Solid understanding of business concepts and issues, preferably in banking, core banking, core modernization, pricing & billing, global custody, sub-custody and cash management for corporate and institutional clients specifically.
  
Hands-on experience in implementing enterprise-level banking software solutions.
  
Demonstrated leadership skills with the ability to inspire and motivate teams to achieve goals.
  
Excellent communication, negotiation, and problem-solving skills.
  
Proven track record of delivering results in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
  
Knowledge of relevant industry regulations, compliance requirements, and quality standards.
  
Domain knowledge in banking and financial institutions and/or large enterprise IT environment.
  
Industry accepted certifications in program management, delivery management, and team management.
  
Knowledge of cloud concepts, and software development / project lifecycle.

title: System Architect Data Collection
description:
Techster Solutions befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst 5+ års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.
  
Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.
  
  

**Rollbeskrivning:**  

What you'll do As a System Architect Data Collection, you will support our clients Engineering in achieving our objectives and becoming data-driven by designing and evolving the in-vehicle data collection system, enabling cross-functional analytics at clients.. The system architect role within the Engineering Data Hub is responsible for performing system analysis and developing logical and physical design of the data collection system based on the architectural vision. The main part of the work is within the embedded systems in the vehicle, but you will also work across vehicle and cloud to realize the complete end-to-end system. You will collaborate with stakeholders and other architects across engineering to evolve the complete data & analytics system architecture for Clients Engineering, covering all operational and analytical data flows between vehicle and cloud. Your main tasks and responsibilities will be to: • Perform system analysis and develop logical and physical design of the data collection system • Present and align your design in architectural decision meetings across Engineering • Drive technical concept evaluation together with development teams • Support development teams to perform embedded software design and implementation What you'll bring We believe that you have a minimum of 8 years of experience in embedded systems architecture, are very knowledgeable and passionate about modern architectural practices and have end-to-end thinking. You have a solid understanding of in-vehicle networks and high performance embedded compute platforms. You also have a validated ability to influence decision-making at all levels within an organization, and in a variety of contexts. It is beneficial if you have: • Knowledge of / experience with data collection • Prior experience within an automotive environment. • Experience with cloud infrastructure. • Well-established relevant network from which to draw advice, guidance, best practices, and industry developments.
  
  

Ansökan Tror du att du är Techster Solutions nästa stjärna? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan nu. Urval sker löpande och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.
  
Arbetsplats och kulturVi är ett entreprenördrivet IT företag, med både produktkunskap och försäljning (Techster AB) och konsultativa tjänster (Techster Solutions AB). Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt.
  
Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Cloud/Platform Engineer sökes till Nordens största...
description:
*Brinner du för automation och cloud? Är du eller vill bli grym på att bygga en skalbar plattform som hjälper några av Sveriges största företag? Söker du samtidigt ett företag som värnar om din utveckling och ger dig verktyg att innovera?*  

  

*Då tycker vi definitivt att du bör läsa vidare!*

  

  

**Om oss**


Visma Enterprise är ett av Nordens ledande företag inom systemlösningar och ingår i en av Europas största IT-koncerner. Vi arbetar med HR- och lönesystem för privat sektor och skapar oslagbara användarupplevelser med marknadsledande teknologi. Nu behöver vi din expertis som infrastructure engineer.  



  

**Om rollen**


I rollen som Cloud Engineer hos oss på Visma kommer du att vara en central del i att bygga en förstklassig plattform för en av våra produkter. Du kommer ges stor frihet att påverka beslut som rör våra driftlösningar, och tillsammans med dina kollegor i ett team på 5 personer kommer ni förädla och förbättra de centrala lösningar som hundratals av våra kunder förlitar sig på.  

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer inkludera:**

* Sätta upp och drifta ett säkert Kubernetes-kluster
* Modernisera och bygga en skalbar infrastruktur
* Diverse uppgifter rörande vår public cloud, AWS-miljö
* Vidareutveckla vår monitorering och larm
* Arbeta med automation av alla våra dagliga processer

 **Om dig**


Över allt annat hoppas vi såklart att du brinner för ovan rollbeskrivning med tillhörande arbetsuppgifter! Vi tror att du har ett par års erfarenhet av utveckling och/eller operations i cloud. Du har det tekniska helhetsperspektivet, är van att arbeta i team och delar gärna med dig av din kunskap, samtidigt som du gillar att lära dig nya saker. Vi tror även att du gillar att se saker från kundens sida, samtidigt som du ser vikten av kvalitativa releaser och en stabil driftmiljö. Som person hoppas vi att du är kommunikativ, lösningsorienterad och trivs bäst med frihet under ansvar.

 **Dina färdigheter**

* Erfarenhet eller ett intresse för GitOps
* Flera års erfarenhet av utvecklingsarbete och eller drift
* Erfarenhet eller ett intresse av Kubernetes
* Ett intresse för build and deploy för att verkligen få ut värdet till kunden
* Erfarenhet av AWS, Azure eller GCP
* Du kommunicerar bra på både svenska och engelska

 **Vi erbjuder dig**

* Flexibilitet och arbete enligt en hybridmodell där du kan arbeta både hemifrån och från ett av våra toppmoderna kontor
* Möjligheten att arbeta med en stor och komplex produkt där du ges stora chanser att påverka framtida utveckling
* Personlig- och professionell utveckling i form av utbildningar och en kompetensdag varje månad
* Omfattande karriärmöjligheter i Nordens största IT-koncern
* Konkurrenskraftiga villkor när det kommer till lön och semester

 **Visst låter det här spännande?**  

  

Vi arbetar med löpande urval, så varmt välkommen att söka tjänsten redan idag. Vid frågor är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef:  

  

Jens Sigvardsson  

jens.sigvardsson@visma.com

  

Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Engagement Program Manager
description:
### **General Information**

**Locations**: Stockholm, Stockholm County, Sweden
  

Role ID
208456
Worker Type
Temporary - with Benefits (EU & Malaysia)
Studio/Department
CTO - Production Infrastructure & Engineering
Flexible Work Arrangement
Hybrid
### **Description & Requirements**

Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.
**The Challenge Ahead**


Production Infrastructure and Engineering’s charter is to make EA's games and services available to all players anytime and anywhere. To do this, we focus on the high availability of infrastructure, primary services, and studio services. We aim to help developers to experiment and build new games quickly with infrastructure services on-demand and workflows that ensure rapid development in the cloud. In all of this, we focus on being there for players where and when they want to play.


You will report into the Director of Program Management and will focus on EA studios in Europe, including Codemasters and Criterion, and EA Sports App.

 **Main Responsibilities:**

* Facilitating launches and live operations of game titles and services: ensuring all PI&E domain owners and PMs have outlined tasks required for launches; understand the impact of partner and PI&E choices related to online infrastructure, product and services
* Manage partner requests: bringing opportunities and partner requests to PI&E following established intake and processes; report on PI&E deliverables to the partners with monthly reports
* You will align partner needs with PI&E product and services: gathering and distributing customer feedback to PI&E product and services team, creating and updating PI&E tech dependencies matrix for each partner, manage PI&E internal knowledge hub where PI&E team members can self-serve information about each partner, including its games, points of contacts, links to the tech dependencies; track partner engagements with an accessible CRM-like system
* You will promote PI&E products and services to partners: representing PI&E products and services to PI&E partners, updating PI&E Hosting Guidelines and other documentation.

 **Experience Required:**

* BS in Computer Science or comparable technical degree, or commensurate experience. Minimum 5 years of technical program/project management experience.
* Experience with Infrastructure and Cloud deployments, migrations, and upgrades across data center related technologies (eCommerce, Network, Security, Systems Administration, Database Administration, Storage).
* Experience managing projects with geographically distributed and culturally diverse work-groups.
* Experience with documentation and work tracking tools like: JIRA, Monday.com, Service Now, Confluence, GitLab, and Sharepoint.
* Delivery track record across multiple large-scale cross group programs, including scrum/team prioritization.
* Ability to manage risks and conflicts through reporting with detailing of a mitigation plan to ensure that the project stays on track, or is brought back on track in the event of delays or blockers.
* Experience with the digital gaming space would be considered a huge plus.

  

  

  

***About Electronic Arts***
We’re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.  

We take a holistic approach with our benefits program, focusing on physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life with paid time off and new parent leave, plus free games and so much more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.  

Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

title: Teknisk skribent med erfarenhet till Saab Surveillance
description:
**Vi söker en teknisk informatör/skribent med erfarenhet av att dokumentera och sammanställa teknisk information i ett strukturerat och användarvänligt format. Du kommer att skapa och hantera manualer, tekniska specifikationer och annan dokumentation för att säkerställa att informationen är tydlig, korrekt och lättillgänglig.**

 **Att jobba som teknisk informatör hos på Saab**


Som teknisk informatör hos Saab Surveillance spelar du en nyckelroll i att göra komplex teknik begriplig genom att skapa tydlig och strukturerad dokumentation. Du får samarbeta med ingenjörer och experter för att samla in och analysera information som blir avgörande för slutanvändarna. Rollen är både kreativ och teknisk, där du får kombinera ditt intresse för teknik med kommunikation. Det är en spännande möjlighet för dig som gillar att fördjupa dig i avancerade system och göra teknisk information lättillgänglig!


Konsultuppdraget är 12 månader men chans till fast anställning hos kund efter slutfört uppdrag.

 **Vi söker dig som**

* 1-3 års erfarenhet av teknisk dokumentation och arbete i Content Management System (CMS).
* God förmåga att analysera och sammanfatta teknisk data.
* Kunskap om taggningssystem, datahantering och konfigurationsstyrd dokumentation.
* Förståelse för tekniska system, exempelvis generatorer, hydraulik och signalbehandling.
* Strukturerad, noggrann och kommunikativ med en analytisk förmåga..
* Har en ingenjörsutbildning inom tekniskt område eller motsvarande.

**Plats:** Göteborg

 **Att vara konsult på Nexer Tech Talent**


Som senior konsult hos Nexer Tech Talent blir du en del av ett nätverk av erfarna specialister. Du kommer att vara anställd av Nexer Tech Talent och arbeta som konsult hos Saab i Göteborg med start enligt så snart som möjligt eller enligt överenskommelse. Du kommer även att få ta del av ett skräddarsytt utbildningsprogram där du får möjlighet att utveckla och fördjupa dina tekniska kunskaper i områden som AI, Cloud och cybersäkerhet, men även inom tex. ledarskap och personlig utveckling.


Vi kommer stötta och utmana dig genom hela uppdraget. Vi erbjuder också möjligheter att delta i nätverksträffar, inspirerande föreläsningar och sociala aktiviteter som stärker din roll i vårt konsultteam. Som konsult hos oss finns också möjlighet att bidra som mentor, där du kan dela med dig av din kunskap och erfarenhet till mer juniora kollegor.

**Ansökan**


Låter detta som en spännande möjlighet? Vi rekryterar löpande, så skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt. Om du har frågor, kontakta Tech Recruiter olivia.holm@nexergroup.com.


Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

**Om Nexer Tech Talent**


Nexer Tech Talent är en del av Nexer Group – ett techbolag med djupa rötter i svenskt entreprenörskap och innovation. Med över 2 500 medarbetare i 15 länder och mer än 35 års erfarenhet hjälper vi våra kunder att ligga steget före strategiskt, teknologiskt och kommunikativt.

title: Warranty/Aftersale Service Specialist - Parental Cover
description:
**Established in 1986 in the Swedish mountains, our love for skiing in untouched terrain and embarking on adventures in the wild run deep. Our purpose is simple: to bring this freeride spirit to the world. With our products, we aim to make adventures possible 365 days a year.**

**We are driven by passion, togetherhood, responsibility and winning spirit. We know that an inspiring spread of unique abilities and personalities contribute to our dynamic culture and our success. Now, we are looking for a new talent to join our team.**


At Peak Performance, we are passionate about our products and dedicated to providing our customers with the best possible experience and service. We are currently seeking a dynamic and motivated individual to join our Consumer Service team as a **Warranty/Aftersale Service Specialist.**


In this role, you will manage our Aftersales service and elevate it to new heights. You will play a crucial role in ensuring our aftersale consumer experience meets the highest standards. The position is based at Peak Performance HQ in Stockholm and reporting to the Consumer Service Manager. The employment is a temporary position that aims to replace an employee on parental leave for approximately one year.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Optimize and maintain processes for warranty claims and spare parts in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders to ensure cost-efficient stock management and handling in alignment with company guidelines
* Provide direct and Level 2 support for consumer requests, including product information, warranty and claim requests, and order information to ensure a smooth and positive customer journey.
* Manage spare parts inventory, including efficient sourcing, procurement, and maintenance of the spare parts library.
* Handling, dispatching and answer spare parts request from tailor, brand store's, outlet's, franchise stores, and end customer
* Maintain inventory records, including stock levels and database updates.
* Manage relationships with tailors and optimize the repair process for cost efficiency.
* Analyze warranty case data and develop roadmaps for future projects
* Participate in the PP Care project team to enhance the longevity of Peak Performance products and communication.
* Collaborate with Sustainability, Quality, and Production teams to create and maintain a go-to tool for repair requests from tailors, stores, retail, and B2B partners.

Act as Peak Performance Product expert  
* 

**Job Requirements:**

* 2-3 years of experience in spare parts, warranty, product quality, aftersales service, or consumer support.
* Business-fluent English skills are required; additional languages relevant to Peak Performance markets are a plus.
* Proficiency in Office365, including advanced Excel skills; knowledge of Salesforce Service Cloud and SAP is a plus.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills to interact effectively with various teams and customers.
* Excellent organizational, time-management, and self-management abilities.
* Analytical skills with a data-driven approach to decision-making.
* Problem-solving skills to identify and resolve issues efficiently.
* Ability to work independently as well as part of a team.
* A strong interest in winter sports and skiing is a plus.

Experience working with Peak Performance products in-store is beneficial.  
* 

**What we offer:**


We offer you an inspiring work environment where our values of Passion, Togetherhood, Responsibility and Winning Spirit are at the core of everything we do, promoting creativity, teamwork, accountability, and progress. You get the opportunity to work with a great team that shares your passion for sports and outdoor life. We are on a growth journey, finding our line and building our future success. That provides interesting challenges and possibilities in all roles for the person who is curious and likes to get things done. We’re small enough for you to play a key role regardless of your position, but big enough to have a global presence. At Peak Performance, you get the best of both worlds.

**To live our brand, we also offer:**

* Workout classes and yoga classes in our Training Box at HQ
* Sports Hour – 1 hour training on Fridays (activity of your own choice)
* Mountain house & Apartment in Åre. Available for rent and team activities.
* Health care allowance – up to 3000 SEK per year
* Skandia Health Insurance


If our values inspire you and you share our passion for outdoor sports and products that combines style and performance, we want you to join our winning team. Apply now and unlock your freeride spirit!

title: System Manager High Availibility
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity:**


We are looking for a System Manager (SM) to work in the High Availability (HA) area within Cloud Native development on a container-based micro-service architecture. You will be part of a team with highly skilled SMs, where you jointly plan the work and share tasks and knowledge. Some of the challenges are maintaining focus on priorities, communicate, inspire and be active in studies needed to drive the area towards the product vision. HA is the most important aspect to secure uncompromised uptime in mobile networks.

  

PDU Packet Core, part of Cloud SW & Services, is passionate about maintaining Ericssons market leadership in Packet Core domain, taking an outstanding position in 5G, and continuing to invest for balanced technology drive within a highly competitive market. We foster a culture of collaboration, learning and technology governance, and we are a well-established global organization.

 **What you will do:**


As System Manager for HA, you will be handling and defining the product requirements regarding resilience, geographical redundancy, overload handling and storage. You will be working in close cooperation with e.g. System Architects, Product Owners, and development teams, managing requirements and influence future evolvement in the area.

  

Among other tasks, this role involves:

* Managing requirements and taking ownership for selected system artifacts
* Performing system studies and managing compliance with standards
* Supporting Q&A activities and providing pre-sales support within the competence area
* Being a member of and contributor to the system management community
* Supporting development teams with system insights and feature studies
* Working closely with stakeholders and related partners across the organization, being involved in early technical discussions and providing recommendations to standardization work
* Manage strategic technical leadership within the area

 **The skills you bring:**

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree or higher education in a technical field related to Computer Science
* Several years of working experience in SW development, security background and knowledge of PC products
* Innovation attitude paired with the ability to adapt and respond to change
* Interest and pride in understanding the whole product and its environment, and passion for learning and sharing information with team members
* Dedication to continue developing your knowledge working at the forefront with new technologies
* Excellent communication skills, paired with fluency in spoken and written English
* A positive “can-do” attitude
* Keen eye for detail, while not being afraid to challenge the status quo
**Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

title: Campaigns Manager
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------

 **About This Opportunity**


At our Ericsson, we are seeking a passionate and motivated individual to join our team and drive campaign activations for our Business Area Cloud Software & Services (BCSS) division. As a member of the BCSS team, you will have the opportunity to help develop, lead, and coordinate inbound marketing initiatives that drive awareness, perception, and demand generation for our Key Offering Areas (KOAs).  

In this role, you will closely collaborate with our campaigns and activations team, social media, communications, and KOA drivers to help deliver against the wier BCSS transformation plans. You’ll have good marketing campaigns experience, but willing to learn more. You’ll being your own specific expertise and knowledge of building and driving a digital first marketing plan that engages and delivers content and campaigns to a growing set of stakeholders and audiences on a global basis.

 **What You Will Do**  

* Develop 360 activation plans for designated KOA campaigns with specific focus on driving an always-on marketing approach
* Provide regional perspective into campaign development to support global market areas (MAs) with their outbound marketing plans
* Develop campaign & content assets for specified KOA campaigns, hero launches, insights, and strategic topics
* Apply storytelling principles to build emotive messages and experiences that engages the CSP market and customers.
* Track and measure success of your always-on marketing efforts to continually optimize the performance against targets & KPIs.
* Collaborate closely with external agencies & global social media community
* Professional agency & budget management to ensure ROI and compliance
 **You will bring**  

* University degree preferably in Marketing, Communications, Business or equivalent
* A minimum of 5 years proven experience working in B2B campaign planning and execution, including extensive knowledge of digital marketing strategies, Management & Reporting.
* Knowledge of content creation, curation, and distribution
* A good understanding of the customer journey and tactics that engage at various stages of the customer buying journey
* A good understanding of the key digital marketing tools and an excitement around AI
* Exceptional attention to detail and organizational skills
* Excellent communication skills in English, both written and spoken
* Ability to encourage others and manage multiple stakeholders
* A curious, creative and experimental mindset

We look forward to your application with CV in English. We target 60% work at the office.

Please note that we do not accept, proceed, or respond for applications sent via e-mail.

title: RAN Robustness Verification Engineer
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity:**

  

Predicting the future is fun! Creating it is powerful! We do both. Ericsson technologies open endless possibilities across industries as a front runner and as technology leader.  

It is our responsibility to secure the quality of Ericsson’s Radio Access Networks (RAN) software against the most exacting customers’ expectations, in the most challenging development context. We integrate the latest 5G and One Open RAN features for high-capacity wireless networks. We integrate and verify 5G and One Open RAN Use Cases to the high standards of demanding customers. Enabling and maintaining Ericsson’s technology and market leadership is our purpose.

 **What you will do:**

  

* Drive, implement and prioritize quality assurance requirements in the 5G and One Open RAN product area with focus on Robustness.
* Contribute to the design of the Robustness test architecture. Integrate and test RAN features.
* Analyze Ericsson RAN product with respect to Robustness and In-Service Performance requirements.
* Secure Ericsson bi-weekly releases of 5G RAN products in Live networks.
* Identify teams, way of working, environment problems and propose solutions to solve them.
* Strive for customer focus and on time delivery.
* Collaborate with colleagues in different sites: Sweden, Poland, China & Croatia.

 **The skills you bring:**

  

* 3 to 5 years’ experience in integration and verification in 5G Radio Access Network technologies.
* MSc or higher education level in Electrical Engineering, Computer Sciences, AI/ML, or equivalent domain.
* Cloud RAN experience.
* Used to handle complex troubleshooting.
* Excellent team working ability. Ability to work independently, support other team members, and receive support when needed.
* The ability to be a role model for the team.
* Proficiency in English.
* Analytic ability, creativity, and drive.
* Drive improvements: detect gaps and initiate changes to fill them.
* Be flexible and customer oriented with international teams.

At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. title: Microsoft 365 Experts
description:
**Company Description** 




 Dorite AB is a established consultancy firm specializing in Microsoft's cloud-based products and platforms. They offer business-related services and technical implementations to simplify and streamline their customers' operations, focusing on creating business productivity.
 



  





**Role Description** 




 This is a full-time hybrid role for a Microsoft 365 Expert at Dorite AB. The role is located in Stockholm but allows for some work from home. The Microsoft 365 Expert will be responsible for day-to-day tasks related to communication, business process improvement, consulting, solution architecture, and cloud computing.
 



  





**Qualifications** 



* Communication skills
* Business Process and Consulting expertise
* Solution Architecture and Cloud Computing knowledge
* Experience in Microsoft 365 and cloud-based platforms
* Ability to work collaboratively and independently
* Strong problem-solving and analytical skills
* Relevant certifications in Microsoft 365 are a plus
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field

title: VMware Cloud Director (VCD) Administrator
description:
**VMware Cloud Director (VCD) Administrator** 



* Deploy and configure VMware Cloud Director components.
* Integrate VMware Cloud Director with vCenter Server and NSX for networking.
* Configure resource pools, storage policies, and other infrastructure elements.
* Create and manage organizations (tenants) and assign roles and permissions to users and groups.
* Enforce security policies and manage access controls.
* Allocate and manage compute, storage, and network resources for tenants.
* Monitor resource utilization and ensure optimal performance.
* Handle resource scaling for dynamic workloads.
* Onboard new tenants and set up their virtual datacenters (vDCs).
* Provide tenants with self-service portals and catalog access.
* Handle tenant-specific configurations, such as virtual networking and VM templates.
* Apply updates and patches to VMware Cloud Director and underlying infrastructure.
* Conduct backup and disaster recovery testing.
* Leverage APIs to automate provisioning and management tasks.
* Integrate VMware Cloud Director with third-party tools or custom scripts for automation.
* Ensure compliance with organizational and regulatory standards.



 Key Skills and Knowledge Areas
 


* Virtualization: Deep understanding of VMware vSphere, including ESXi hosts and vCenter Server.
* Networking: Knowledge of VMware NSX (V or T), VLANs, VPNs, and software-defined networking (SDN).
* Storage: Experience with storage systems and VMware storage technologies like vSAN.
* Cloud Management: Familiarity with multi-tenancy and self-service concepts.
* Scripting: Skills in scripting languages such as PowerShell, Python, or RESTful API usage.
* Security: Understanding of security principles, firewalls, and access control.



 Tools and Technologies
 


* VMware Cloud Director: Primary platform for administration.
* vSphere/vCenter: Managing the underlying infrastructure.
* NSX: For networking and security.
* vRealize Suite: Includes tools like vRealize Operations and vRealize Orchestrator.
* Third-party integrations: Tools like Terraform or Ansible for infrastructure as code



 --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 



 VMware Aria Automation Administrator
 


* Design, develop, and maintain automation workflows using VMware Aria Automation.
* Develop self-service catalogs and automate the provisioning of virtual machines (VMs), containers, and applications.
* Create and manage Infrastructure as Code (IaC) solutions using Aria and integrate with tools like Terraform, Ansible, or Puppet.
* Design, develop, and maintain vRA blueprints for provisioning and managing virtual machines and applications.
* Customize workflows using VMware Aria Orchestrator (vRO) to support complex automation and integrations.
* Implement role-based access control (RBAC) and governance policies to manage resource access in cloud environments.



 VMware Aria Operations:
 


* Set up and manage VMware Aria Operations to monitor the performance, health, and capacity of cloud infrastructure.
* Create custom dashboards, alerts, and reports for end-to-end visibility of multi-cloud environments.
* Conduct performance tuning, capacity planning, and resource optimization to ensure the efficiency of virtualized and cloud resources.
* Troubleshoot and resolve issues in vSphere, ESXi, NSX, and other VMware products using Aria Operations insights.
* Implement alerting and integration with monitoring tools (e.g., Nagios, Zabbix).
* Automate the provisioning and management of cloud resources across private, public, and hybrid cloud environments.
* Work with cloud-native services (Kubernetes, Tanzu) and integrate VMware Aria with DevOps pipelines (e.g., Jenkins, GitLab).
* Collaborate with cloud architects and DevOps teams to align automation processes with business goals.
* Support CI/CD pipelines and infrastructure as code (IaC) using tools such as Terraform, Jenkins, or GitLab.



 Qualifications:
 


* Required Skills:
* Hands-on experience with VMware Aria Automation, Aria Operations, and Aria Cost.
* Proficiency in developing automation blueprints, workflows, and using APIs to integrate Aria with other platforms.
* Expertise in vSphere, NSX-T, vSAN, and other VMware infrastructure components.
* Strong understanding of cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud, with experience managing multi-cloud environments.
* Experience with scripting languages such as PowerShell, JavaScript, or Python for automation tasks.
* Familiarity with infrastructure-as-code (IaC) tools like Terraform and configuration management tools like Ansible.
* Experience with VMware vRealize Automation (vRA) 7.x/8.x and vRealize Operations (vROps) 7.x/8.x.
* Expertise in developing vRA blueprints, workflows, and infrastructure-as-code principles.
* Strong knowledge of vSphere, ESXi, and vCenter.
* Hands-on experience with vRO workflows, scripting (JavaScript, PowerShell, or Python), and API integration.



  




* Preferred Skills:
* Experience with VMware NSX-T, SRM, or other VMware products.
* Knowledge of ITIL processes and agile methodologies.
* Certification in VMware (VCP, VCAP, or VCDX)
* Experience with Kubernetes, Tanzu, or other container management platforms.



 Familiarity with DevOps practices, CI/CD pipelines, and integratin

* Virtualization: Deep understanding of VMware vSphere, including ESXi hosts and vCenter Server.
* Networking: Knowledge of VMware NSX (V or T), VLANs, VPNs, and software-defined networking (SDN).
* Storage: Experience with storage systems and VMware storage technologies like vSAN.
* Cloud Management: Familiarity with multi-tenancy and self-service concepts.
* Scripting: Skills in scripting languages such as PowerShell, Python, or RESTful API usage.
* Security: Understanding of security principles, firewalls, and access control.



 Tools and Technologies
 


* VMware Cloud Director: Primary platform for administration.
* vSphere/vCenter: Managing the underlying infrastructure.
* NSX: For networking and security.
* vRealize Suite: Includes tools like vRealize Operations and vRealize Orchestrator.
* Third-party integrations: Tools like Terraform or Ansible for infrastructure as code

title: Customer Success Manager
description:
Do you have passion for Financial Markets and innovative fintech? Are you in a client facing role and want to grow your career by establishing network amongst C-level in the Finance industry? Do you thrive in an entrepreneurial and fast pace environment? Quartr is now looking for an ambitious professional to join the sales team, ensuring Quartr clients have a great product experience and outstanding service.
   

  

**About The Sales Team**
 Quartr is internationalizing the sales team consisting of highly driven professionals, selling disruptive products across various industry verticals. Quartr is growing rapidly with international clients ranging from top-tier hedge funds, and top-tier asset managers, to sell-side equity research institutions, and Fortune 500 companies. This role is located in Stockholm, with three days a week in office.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 As a Customer Success Manager at Quartr, you are responsible for managing and working closely with our current clients to support their journey in extracting the most value out of the usage of our products and experience best in class service. You are responsible for renewals with current clients and users, as well as:
   

  

* Demo- and training sessions
* Servicing our clients requests and trials
* Extracting insights on the value delivered to clients to share with our product team to dictate the products direction
* Work closely with our team of high performing Account Executives to identify upsell opportunities


**What Will Help You Succeed**
* Interest in the stock market and investments
* A superior ability to create rapport with new people, develop- and maintain relationships
* High energy with creativity and curiousity, with adaptable mindset
* Strong knowledge of the Finance industry and an international mindset
* Experience from client facing roles and customer orientation
* Experience in working with SaaS products
* Professional outlook with strong ambition and business acumen
* Excellent communication skills in verbal and written
* Previous experience from Customer Success roles is a plus


***Note:***
*you need to be based in Sweden with a valid work permit. We are also not looking for consultants or help from recruitment agencies.*
**Why join Quartr?**
* Do your life's work


 We focus passionately on doing things with very high quality across our entire organization.
   

  

* Join the foundational team


 We are still in the very early innings of what we believe to be a multi-decade journey.
   

  

* High performing culture


 Work from where you are the most productive. At Quartr we have a people first, performing culture enabling your growth and development.
   

  

* Skin in the game


 We truly believe in the power of incentives and in sharing the company's success with the team, so every employee is offered qualified stock options.
   

  

* Competitive salary & options


 To deliver at the highest level, we of course need the best people. This is reflected in our compensation.
   

  

* Wellness allowance


 We want to encourage health and exercise through a generous wellness allowance.
   

  

**About Quartr**
 Quartr is a software company serving the world of finance. The Quartr ecosystem gives millions of investors and corporate professionals worldwide easy access to first-party information from public companies through various services – including a web app, a mobile app, and an API solution. Recognized as one of Fast Company's Most Innovative Companies for 2024, Quartr is also backed by top investors.
   

  

**Learn More About Quartr**
**Quartr x Perplexity** 
 our partnership with Perplexity
   

  

**Quartr secures Investment from Altos Ventures** 
 partnering with respected San Fransisco-based VC firm to further accelerate growth and continue transforming qualitative market research
   

  

**Fourth Most Innovative Company in Personal Finance 2024** 
 as recognized by Fast Company

title: Support Technician
description:
**Xensam: SAM Disrupters** 




 Xensam is the leading provider of AI-powered, cloud-hosted Software Asset Management technology. We’re looking for key players to join us as we scale our impact and build the Xensam team together. We take our culture seriously and strive to maintain the excellence, energy & enthusiasm that flows through the organization today.
 



  





 We look for candidates who are passionate about what they do and ready to work the Xensam way. We know that experience counts, but we also know that it’s you, the person behind the experience, that makes it count.
 



  





**About the role** 




 We are now looking for a customer-focused and collaborative colleague to join our growing team. You will be working with our technical support team and providing high-quality support to customers worldwide. You will support with testing (QA) of our technical solutions and guide and educate our users on how to best configure and make use of our Software.
 



  





*This role offers significant growth opportunities for advancement within the company. If you have a dream career path, this position can lead you there at Xensam.* 




  





**Responsibilities** 



* Providing technical assistance to customers and end-users.
* Diagnosing and resolving software-related issues.
* Communicating effectively with customers.
* Managing and documenting support tickets.
* Collaborating with the technical team for issue resolution.
* Staying updated on Xensam's software products and updates.
* Gathering and relaying customer feedback for product improvement.



  





**Qualifications** 




 We are seeking individuals who are service-oriented problem solvers and have a passion for learning new things. To succeed in this role, we also value the following qualifications:
 


* Good basic technical competence.
* Some experience in Software Support (B2B).
* Troubleshooting experience.
* Effective research skills (Google and reading knowledge base).
* Proficiency in Windows/Mac/Linux.
* Excellent communication skills, both in written and verbal English and Swedish.
* Adaptability and willingness to learn about the industry and market trends.
* Self-motivated and target-oriented, with a hunger to develop within the company.



  





 We are looking for two individuals for this position, one of whom should have prior experience in SaaS and Software Asset Management.
 



  





**What you get** 



* A dynamic position embracing "freedom under responsibility".
* Three days in-office (with remote work on Mondays and Fridays).
* Free access to beverages, snacks, gym facilities, on-site massage, shuffleboard, and other games.
* If sales targets are met, all employees enjoy an annual destination trip.
* Join an ambitious and diverse team, and work with cutting-edge technology in the fastest-growing SAM software on the market.
* An opportunity to shape your career growth while contributing to the company’s success.



  





**At Xensam, our core values define our culture** 




**Rebellious** 
 : We encourage a spirit of freedom and initiative within responsibility.
 



**Humane** 
 : We foster a caring, inclusive environment that values diversity and respects individuality.
 



**Harmonious** 
 : We promote work-life balance, creating a pleasant, supportive workplace.
 



  





 Join Xensam for a balanced, collaborative, and growth-focused work environment. If you're a team player ready to thrive,
 **APPLY now!** 




  





 As part of our recruitment process, we conduct background checks on final candidates to fulfill our commitments to customers and ensure a safe work environment.

title: Cybersecurity Solution Architect
description:
**Cybersecurity Solution Architect:** 




  





 For one of our globally leading tech clients we are urgently looking for an experienced Cybersecurity Solution Architect for a long contract based in Stockholm, Sweden.
 



  





  





 Its paying well and my client can interview asap!
 



  









**Job Description:** 



* As CS Solution Architect you will focus on technical aspects of security solutions like PKI, IDS, Secure boot and work with conceptual CS solutions and architectural topology, writing cybersecurity attribute requirements and provide guidelines for allocation of requirements on ECU level.
* You will also execute the vehicle TARA by considering E/E architect and project topology, exposed interfaces to vehicle, system and components, drive the project from cybersecurity point of view, define CS project time plan, coordinate, and drive the project with affected stakeholders and ensure deliveries according to the overall time plan in project.
* As Architect you need to have strong project management skills to drive actual implementation of cybersecurity features such as Key Management System across organization.



  





  





**Desirable Skills:** 



* Previous experience of working with type approval for R155
* Previous experience of working as CS engineer or CS architect with focus on embedded engineering.
* Knowledge within cybersecurity requirement system engineering
* Knowledge of TARA execution.
* Knowledge of connected communication technologies (CAN, Ethernet)
* Documented experience of writing cybersecurity requirement based on common practices.
* Good knowledge of PKI (both Onboard (Vehicle/ ECU level) and Offboard (Cloud)) + Key Management System
* Experience in developing and/or designing CS solutions specially SecOC on J1939 and LIN is a plus.
* Familiar with Vector solutions within cybersecurity.



  





  





  





 If this is you, then please do not delay in applying!

title: Windowsspecialist med Nätverkskunskap
description:
*Vi på Iver ger samma löfte till våra kollegor som till våra kunder. Löftet är att alltid vara ”* 
 beside you”, ”behind you” och ”before you”. Vi kallar det för ”The Iver way”.
 *Nu söker vi en "Windowsspecialist med Nätverkskunskap" som vill bli en del av Iver och som vill vara med och bidra till bättre IT-lösningar som gör skillnad för våra kunder! Är du vår nya kollega?*
**Rollen Som Windowsspecialist**
 Vi söker en erfaren Windowsspecialist med goda kunskaper inom nätverk för att stärka vårt team. I denna roll kommer du att arbeta med drift, underhåll och utveckling av våra kunders IT-miljöer, med fokus på Windows-baserade system och nätverksinfrastruktur.
   

  

 Du kommer att vara en nyckelperson i att säkerställa hög tillgänglighet, stabilitet och säkerhet. Tjänsten innebär både operativt och strategiskt arbete, där du får möjlighet att påverka och förbättra våra kunders IT-miljö.
   

  

 Du kommer att vara en del av ett kundteam med ansvar för några av våra kunders tjänsteleverans. Vi arbetar med områden så som arkitektur, projekt, drift/förvaltning av våra kunders infrastruktur och nät. Våra kunder är ofta stora nordiska företag, fintech, startups eller myndigheter med krav på hög nivå av informationssäkerhet och lösningar i teknisk framkant. Vissa av dem utgör samhällskritisk verksamhet.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
* Administration, underhåll och felsökning av Windows Server-miljöer
* Hantering av Active Directory, GPO, DNS, DHCP och andra Windows-tjänster
* Övervakning och optimering av nätverksinfrastruktur (LAN/WAN, brandväggar, switchar, VPN)
* Säkerhetsarbete, inklusive patchhantering och skydd mot intrång
* Implementering och hantering av backup- och återställningslösningar
* Dokumentation och förbättring av IT-processer


**Vad erbjuder vi dig?**
 Iver - We empower our Nordic society. Hos Iver får du möjlighet att arbeta med den senaste tekniken och vara med på en spännande tillväxtresa. På Iver är vi inkluderande och strävar efter genuint samarbete där vi arbetar mot gemensamma mål. Inom Iver finns stora möjligheter till utveckling och vi står bakom dig när du vill lära dig mer – inom ditt specialområde, ledarskap eller nya områden. Hos Iver är du också en del av ett ambitiöst och innovativt företag, vilket innebär att förbättra, testa, utvärdera och våga ändra hur vi gör saker är viktiga ingredienser och vi är övertygade om att det är så vi utvecklas.
   

  

**Din Bakgrund Och Profil**
 Du plockade troligen sönder den första dator du fick bara för att se hur den fungerar, och du har lagt en ansenlig mängd tid på att bygga Lego under din uppväxt. Din vilja att förstå hur saker fungerar är mer än bara ett arbete eller inlärt beteende. Därutöver trivs du sannolikt av att jobba i ett högpresterande team och drivs av viljan att göra tekniska lösningar i framkant ännu bättre.
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen vill vi att du har:
   

  

* Flera års erfarenhet av Windows-serveradministration
* Erfarenhet av utveckling av arkitektur och design för Active Directory
* Proaktivt underhållsarbete för AD / ADFS / Windows Server
* PowerShell
* Nätverk, tcp/ip och brandvägg
* Erfarenhet av Windows failover kluster


**Meriterande Kunskaper**
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med Microsoft Exchange
* Produktionsmiljö med särskilda krav på informationssäkerhet och tillgänglighet
* MS PKI / Certifikathantering
* Övervakning och visualisering med exempelvis Prometheus, Grafana, Kibana
* Virtualisering


***Vi kommer att göra bakgrundskontroller i rekryteringsprocessen. Svenskt medborgarskap är ett krav.***
**Placeringsort**
 Iver har kontor i Sverige och Norge. Denna roll är placerad i
 **Solna** 
 i härliga lokaler.
   

  

**Sök till oss!**
 Urval sker löpande, tjänsten kan tillsättas före sista ansökningsdag. Iver eftersträvar en jämn könsfördelning och värdesätter etnisk och kulturell mångfald. Önskad start är snarast eller enligt överenskommelse. Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-03-16. Du är välkommen att kontakta Melvin Obita (melvin.obita@iver.se) vid frågor eller funderingar kring tjänsten. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Välkommen till Iver!
   

  

**We empower our Nordic society** 
 . Iver är en ledande nordisk helhetsleverantör av molnbaserade IT-tjänster med spetskompetens inom drift, cybersäkerhet, cloud och innovation.
   

  

**Våra tjänster är kritiska inte bara för våra kunder – utan för digitaliseringen av samhället i stort.** 
 Vi säkerställer att sjukvården har tillgång till rätt patientdata, att samhällskritiska system aldrig ligger nere och att flygplanen landar säkert. Som en lyhörd och affärsnära helhetspartner möjliggör vi våra kunders innovation – idag och imorgon.

title: Cyber Security Architect
description:

 , you will be responsible for defining and implementing

 such as

 , and other cybersecurity measures. You will work on conceptual security solutions, define architectural topology, write cybersecurity attribute requirements, and provide

 Your role includes executing the

 , considering

 , coordinate with stakeholders, and ensure

 of experience in

title: Chief Technology Officer (Sweat Equity Co-Founder, Part-time)
description:
**Join Mindioo – An AI Powered Platform for Coaches, Creators and Clients in the area of personal and spiritual development** 




  





 Mindioo is an early-stage startup with a remote, international team developing an AI-powered platform with business tools and a global marketplace for services, resources, and digital products. Our mission is to support coaches, creators, and clients in the personal and spiritual development space. We are targeting a public launch of our product in May 2025 for the US market.
 



  





**The Problem We’re Solving** 




 Coaches and Creators often struggle with managing multiple tools, lacking the time or technical expertise to run their businesses efficiently. Clients face challenges finding quality resources and maintaining organized connections with their favorite creators or coaches. Mindioo solves this with a fully integrated platform, connecting professionals with new clients and providing tools needed to succeed, while giving clients easy access to a wide array of services and resources in one place.
 



  





**About the Role** 




 We are looking for an experienced CTO or a senior Lead Software Engineer to lead our technical strategy through both the launch and scaling phases. You’ll guide our development team, ensure high-quality product delivery, and help shape the future of Mindioo.
 



  





**Responsibilities:** 



* Lead and coordinate the development team.
* Shape technical strategy and oversee product development.
* Manage technical debt and ensure product scalability.
* Drive Alpha and Beta testing and iterations.
* Recruit, onboard, and mentor engineers.
* Align technology with business strategy.
* Monitor development speed and cost, removing blockers.
* Manage security and privacy standards.



  





**Requirements:** 



* Proven experience as a Lead Software Engineer or CTO.
* Experience developing SaaS products and marketplaces.
* Strong hands-on technical skills with our tech stack.
* Background in AI-powered platforms, social networks, or digital marketplaces.
* Strong leadership, communication, and problem-solving skills.
* Relevant education.
* Fluent in English.
* Bonus: Experience launching SaaS platforms in the US and interest in personal and spiritual development.



  





**Tech Stack:** 



* Frontend: TypeScript, React.js, Next.js
* Backend: TypeScript/Node.js, Supabase
* Storage: PostgreSQL, Redis
* Infrastructure: AWS, Jenkins, GitHub Actions
* Integrations: Stripe API



  





**Job Details:** 



* Sweat equity Co-Founder role.
* Salary to be discussed once the company has sufficient revenue or funding
* Part-time (10-15 hours/week, flexible).
* Must be available a few hours during CET.
* Fully remote.
* Flexible start date.



  





**Why Join Mindioo?** 



* Equity in our start-up and a place in the core founding team.
* Collaborate with experienced, international entrepreneurs.
* Be part of an impact-driven, global launch.
* Anticipate strategic exit opportunities as we scale.



  





 Mindioo is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

title: Technical Customer Support
description:
**HÄNG MED PÅ VÅR RESA ATT DIGITALISERA PROV GLOBALT 🌎**
 Digiexam är ett svenskt SaaS- och EdTech-bolag, grundat 2011. Vi stöttar över 900 ledande universitet, skolor och institutioner världen över med vår pålitliga och användarvänliga provlösning. Sedan starten har vi blivit en ledande digital provplattform med över 350 000 användare i 14 länder - och mer än 17 miljoner prov har genomförts.
   

  

**OM ROLLEN**
 Som Customer Support hos oss är du en viktig del av att säkerställa att lärare och andra användare får bästa möjliga upplevelse av vår provplattform. Vår supportfunktion får väldigt fin feedback från våra användare och under 2024 har vi en kundnöjdhet på 98%.
   

  

 Rollen har en teknisk inriktning och passar perfekt för dig som har några års erfarenhet av supportarbete, har ett stort tekniskt intresse, känner dig bekväm med att läsa och förstå kod eller har erfarenhet inom teknisk felsökning.
   

  

**I Rollen Kommer Du Bland Annat Att**
* Guida lärare och skoladministratörer i vår plattform och svara på deras frågor
* Hantera inkommande ärenden, främst via vår supportplattform Intercom
* Felsöka buggar, identifiera tekniska problem och skapa nya interna tickets med teknisk felformulering till Tech-team
* Genomföra tester inför nya releaser från vårt Product & Tech-team
* Skapa guider och utbildningsmaterial för både svensk- och engelsktalande användare
* Samarbeta tight med både vårt Product & Tech-team och Customer Success-team


**VAD VI ERBJUDER**
 Du Blir En Del Av Vårt Internationella Team På 20 Kollegor Med Kontor i Stockholm. Förutom Att Bli En Del Av Ett Team Med Tight Samarbete i En Ambitiös SaaS-miljö, Så Erbjuder Vi Dig
   

  

* Ett flexibelt arbetsupplägg där du kan kombinera arbete hemifrån med samarbete på kontoret i Slussen 1-2 dagar i veckan
* Ett omfattande förmånspaket som inkluderar fast lön, pension och försäkringar
* 30 dagars semester och en frukostbuffé varje tisdag
* Ett friskvårdsbidrag på 5 000 SEK och gemensamma träningspass under arbetstid varje månad
* Regelbundna teambuilding-aktiviteter som After Works, Kick-offs samt Sommar- och Julfester


**VEM DU ÄR**
 Vi Letar Efter Dig Som Är Bra På Att Vägleda Andra Och Trivs i Roller Där Du Får Lösa Problem. Du Är Tekniskt Intresserad Och Nyfiken, Samt Har En God Vana Av Att Jobba Organiserat Och Självgående. Utöver Detta Ser Vi Att Du Har
   

  

* Några års erfarenhet av kundsupport, teknisk support eller liknande roll
* God muntlig och skriftlig kunskap i både svenska och engelska
* Grundläggande förståelse och erfarenhet om hur webbteknologier och applikationer fungerar (HTML, CSS, Javascript) samt erfarenhet av enklare SQL eller liknande
* Förståelse för versionshantering och exempelvis Git


 Vår tekniska miljö består i övrigt av React, TypeScript
 **,** 
 BigQuery, AWS, Postman och det är meriterande med kunskap eller erfarenhet från någon av dessa.
   

  

**REDO ATT HÖRA MER?**
 Vi ser fram emot att lära känna dig bättre! Ansök på bara några minuter genom att använda din LinkedIn-profil eller ladda upp ditt CV och svara på några inledande screeningfrågor. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

title: Cloud Solutions Architect - Alliances
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1000+ colleagues in 70+ countries and very few roles based in offices. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder led, profitable and growing. We are hiring an
 **Cloud Solutions Architect in our Alliances team** 
 to help our biggest partners (companies like Intel, Nvidia, Google, Dell, HP, Accenture, Tata and the like) understand and embrace our open source platform for themselves and their customers.
   

  

 Our worldwide field engineering team apply expert insights to real-world customer problems, enabling the enterprise adoption of Ubuntu, OpenStack, Kubernetes, AI/MLOps and a wide range of associated technologies. We are experts in the whole open source stack, from kernel to desktop, from cloud to the edge. Our team is also interested in business problems - building things reliably, efficiently and cost-effectively, and we have to learn to speak the language of our customers and their industries.
   

  

 We help global companies embrace public and private cloud infrastructure, cloud native operations, and open source applications. For this team we are looking for several Alliances Engineers to support OEM (hardware manufacturers), GSI (global system integrators), ISV (independent software vendors), Channel partners and Public Cloud alliance partners. You will support various alliances and partners of Canonical to adopt our products and technologies, help business leaders to define joint go-to-market programs with partners from the technical standpoint.
   

  

 We often say that our field engineers have 'the hardest job at Canonical' because customers can ask about any aspect of our solutions and products and expect a thoughtful, well-informed answer. We always want to do the best thing for our partners and customers, regardless of our company interests, and field engineers are the people we trust to ensure that is true.
   

  

**Location** 
 : This is a home-based role, we are hiring worldwide.
   

  

 What your day will look like
   

  

* Understand Ubuntu, Linux, networking and services in real-world environments
* Architect cloud infrastructure solutions like Kubernetes, Kubeflow, OpenStack, Ceph, and Spark either On-Premises or in Public Cloud (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)
* Architect and integrate popular open source software such as PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Kafka, Cassandra and NGINX
* Help partners to offer and architect joint solutions utilizing Canonical's technologies on top of the public clouds and in the data center
* Design and publish joint Reference Architectures and perform technical validations with various partners
* Prepare and run onboarding sessions/workshops with various partners' teams to promote Canonical products and solutions


 If you have a passion for the latest open source technologies, cloud-native development, data center technologies such as Kubernetes and computer networking, you will love the Alliances Architect role at Canonical.
   

  

 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* Extensive experience with Linux (Ubuntu preferred), Kubernetes, Ceph, software automation
* Experience designing and implementing solutions on top of public or private clouds
* Python and bash understanding, troubleshooting skills
* Fluent written and spoken English
* Excellent communication and presentation skills
* High motivation, ability to multi-task and follow-up reliably on commitments
* Interest in customer-facing engagement, including pitching, demonstrating and understanding customer environment and needs
* Interest in new technologies like LXD, Juju and Snaps
* Ability to travel globally up to 30% of the time
* Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics or related technical field experience


 What we offer you
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person - we've been working remotely since 2004!
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues from your team and others
* Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.
   

  

 Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.
