title: Salesforce Insurance Cloud Architect
description:
We are seeking a Salesforce Industries/Insurance Cloud expert to head up the roll-out of Salesforce Insurance Cloud for a key customer in Sweden.
 



  





 You will standardize and harmonize processes across the region, to achieve consistent user experience, ensuring scalability and efficiency through Salesforce Insurance Cloud.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Lead the harmonization of the business model within Salesforce, ensuring consistency and flexibility for local needs
* Manage Swedish deployment using Salesforce DX, ensuring data integrity and regulatory compliance
* Automate business processes (e.g., claims, underwriting) with Salesforce Flow, Process Builder, and Apex
* Integrate Salesforce with third-party systems for real-time data sync
* Develop custom Apex classes, Lightning Components, and reports tailored to region's needs
* Ensure global security and compliance with Swedish standards



  





**You will have:** 



* Expertise in Salesforce Industries (Vlocity), Salesforce DX, and integrations
* Experience with Swedish financial or Insurance sector Salesforce deployments and understanding Swedish compliance
* Strong skills in automation, security, and custom development
* Proficiency in using OmniStudio for building complex workflows, process automation, and dynamic user interfaces. This includes using tools like OmniScripts, DataRaptors, Integration Procedures, and Vlocity Cards
* Strong understanding of integrating Industries solutions with Salesforce core services, including Service Cloud, Sales Cloud, and Marketing Cloud for a seamless customer experience
* Knowledge in Industries' data models and the ability to integrate external systems with Salesforce Industries using REST, SOAP APIs, and other integration tools like MuleSoft
* Must have understanding of Swedish compliance and security regulations: GDPR, Swedish Data Protection Act (Dataskyddslagen), FSA (Finansinspektionen) Regulations, Solvency II, SOC 2 (System and Organization Controls), Insurance Distribution Directive (IDD) and eIDAS (Electronic Identification and Trust Services)



  





***This role requires you to be on the customer's site 3 days per week, in Stockholm***




***Hourly/Daily rate to be discussed on a phone call with Daniel Indranathan***




  





 This role offers the chance to eventually lead a multi-regional EMEA initiative, enhancing efficiency and collaboration.

title: CloudOps Engineer
description:
*Vill du vara med på en spännande tillväxtresa i ett av Sveriges snabbast växande IT-bolag? Här får du en nyckelroll mot att bygga och optimera en framtidssäkrad infrastruktur!* 




  





**Om företaget** 




 Norteam är ett av Sveriges snabbast växande IT-bolag med fokus på molnbaserade lösningar. Med expertis inom Microsofts ekosystem – inklusive Azure, Microsoft 365 och Dynamics 365 – erbjuder Norteam lösningar anpassade efter varje kunds unika behov. Lösningar som bygger på Microsofts ledande säkerhetstjänster som tillsammans med IT-supporten garanterar närvaro och kvalitet i alla samarbeten. Norteam erbjuder en rad olika IT-tjänster, från first-line support och IT-projektledning till egenutvecklade SaaS-plattformar.
 



  





 Norteams vision är att IT inte bara ska vara ett stöd utan också en drivkraft för att stärka kundernas konkurrenskraft genom ökad effektivitet och hållbarhet. Här blir du en nyckelperson i företagets resa mot att bygga och optimera en framtidssäkrad teknisk infrastruktur.
 



  





**Arbetsuppgifter** 




 Som Cloud Engineer har du en central roll i att stödja och driva tekniska projekt inom molnbaserade lösningar, med fokus på Azure, Windows, nätverk och Microsoft 365-miljöer. Du arbetar både operativt och strategiskt, i nära samarbete med projektteam, IT-support och förvaltningsavdelningen.
 



  





 •
 **Projektarbete:** 
 Delta i planering, implementering och övervakning av projekt som innefattar migreringar till Azure, uppsättning av nya Windows-miljöer, nätverksuppgraderingar och utveckling av Microsoft 365-tjänster.
 



 •
 **Teknisk support:** 
 Hantera och lösa komplexa tekniska problem, agera expertstöd för IT-supportteamet och säkerställa hög kvalitet i användarsupporten.
 



 •
 **Förvaltning och optimering** 
 : Samarbeta med förvaltningsavdelningen för att säkerställa stabilitet, säkerhet och kostnadseffektivitet i företagets tekniska lösningar, samt identifiera och genomföra förbättringar.
 



 •
 **Utveckling och kunskapsdelning:** 
 Utveckla din tekniska expertis inom molnteknologi, systemadministration och nätverksarkitektur, och dela din kunskap för att stärka organisationens tekniska kompetens.
 



  





**Utbildning, erfarenhet och personliga egenskaper** 




 • Flera års arbetslivserfarenhet av att arbeta i en teknisk roll med fokus på servrar, inklusive installation, drift och underhåll av Windows-serversystem.
 



 • God förståelse för nätverksprotokoll, routing och säkerhetsprinciper.
 



 • Erfarenhet av att hantera och optimera Microsoft 365-tjänster, såsom Exchange Online, SharePoint och Teams.
 



 • Erfarenhet av att arbeta med Azure-molntjänster, inklusive implementering, drift och optimering är meriterande.
 



 • Obehindrad svenska samt engelska i tal och skrift.
 



  





 Som person är du lösningsorienterad och trivs med att ta eget ansvar samtidigt som du har lätt för att samarbeta i team. Du är analytisk och strukturerad, vilket gör att du snabbt kan sätta dig in i komplexa tekniska utmaningar och hitta effektiva, långsiktiga lösningar.
 



  





 Ditt pedagogiska sätt gör att du kan kommunicera tekniska koncept på ett sätt som är lättförståeligt för både tekniska och icke-tekniska målgrupper, vilket gör dig till en uppskattad samarbetspartner. Du har en stark känsla för service och arbetar proaktivt för att säkerställa hög kvalitet i allt du gör. Din nyfikenhet och vilja att utvecklas driver dig att hålla dig uppdaterad inom det senaste inom teknikområdet, vilket bidrar till att skapa värde för verksamheten.
 



  





**Övrig information** 




 Start: Enligt överenskommelse.
 



 Plats: Ranhammarsvägen 20, Bromma, Stockholm. Här tillämpas en office-first policy för alla medarbetare. Kolla gärna in Norteams Instagram och LinkedIn för att få en känsla över hur det är att jobba här!
 



  





 Den här tjänsten är en direktrekrytering vilket innebär att rekryteringsprocessen sker genom Brillante och du anställs direkt hos Norteam. Vi gör ett löpande urval, så skicka in din ansökan redan idag!
 



  





 Vid frågor eller funderingar, kontakta ansvarig rekryterare Elice Öhman via
 **elice.ohman@bravura.se** 
 eller 076-721 49 82.

title: Senior Product Manager
description:
The food industry needs to change, and fast. At Klimato, we’re helping businesses measure, report, and reduce their environmental impact with a platform designed for real results. Our solution is already trusted by global companies, and as we scale, we need a
 
**Product Manager** 

 who can turn strategy into execution—someone who understands both business and tech and knows how to navigate the realities of startup life.
 




  




**The Role** 
* You’ll be responsible for shaping our product direction, ensuring that we build what truly matters. This means owning the roadmap, balancing priorities, and making sure the entire company understands
 
**where we are, where we need to go, and what it takes to get there** 

 .
* Clear communication will be key. You’ll ensure that leadership, engineers, and business teams
 
**understand the trade-offs, challenges, and opportunities ahead** 

 , making sure product decisions aren’t just made, but truly understood.
* You’ll need to be comfortable moving across different levels—from
 
**high-level strategic** 

 discussions about direction and focus,
 
**to tactical work** 

 where scoping and prioritization are key
 
**, and down to the operational level** 

 where you support teams in the day-to-day with clarifications, testing, and assumption management.
* You’ll work closely with designers, business teams and customer support to uncover real customer needs—translating insights into clear, actionable improvements. Prioritization will be a constant challenge: not just deciding what to build, but making sure teams understand the
 
**what, why, and how** 

 behind every feature.
* Data will guide our decisions. You’ll ensure we track the right metrics, make trade-offs based on impact, and create a culture where
 
**real progress beats vanity metrics** 

 . And while the job is hands-on, you’ll also align leadership, engineering, and business teams around a shared vision—turning ambitious goals into achievable milestones.



  




**Who You Are** 
* You’ve worked in
 
**startups or scaleups** 

 before and understand the challenges that come with growth. You know how to
 
**balance business needs with technical constraints** 

 and have experience working closely with engineers.
* You don’t just talk strategy—you execute. You’ve
 
**made tough trade-offs** 

 , shipped meaningful improvements, and learned from experience. You’re pragmatic, knowing when to push forward and when to pivot. Above all, you focus on
 
**building real value, not just ticking off features** 

 .
* You’re also a
 
**strong communicator** 

 —able to break down complexity, set clear expectations, and ensure alignment across teams. Whether it’s a roadmap update, a tough prioritization call, or a technical challenge, you make sure people don’t just hear decisions—they understand them.



  




**Why Join Us?** 


 We’re tackling a global challenge with
 
**a team that values execution over buzzwords** 

 . This is an opportunity to drive real impact—without the fluff, just meaningful work in a fast-moving company. If that sounds like you, let’s talk.

title: Traineeprogram Infor M3 - Stockholm
description:
**Är du nyexaminerad och vill snabbstarta din karriär som affärskonsult?** 




 -Börja hos oss i augusti 2025 och starta med vårt traineeprogram!
 



  





**Första tiden på Meridion är en traineeperiod där de första månaderna fokuserar på utbildning. Interna utbildningar inom vår projektmodell och våra koncept, men även externa utbildningar via våra partners för att lära dig programvaran Infor M3. Stor vikt kommer läggas på din personliga kompetensutveckling.** 




  





**Om oss** 




 Meridion är ett konsultbolag som arbetar med ett av världens största affärssystem (ERP), Infor M3 och beslutstödssystemet Qlik för att genomföra förändringar hos våra kunder. Vi arbetar primärt åt storbolag inom kategorin tillverkande och distribuerade. Våra kunder finns både i Sverige och utanför dess gränser.
 



  





 Vi har tre fina kontor, ett i Göteborg vid Stigbergstorget, ett i Anderstorp och ett i Stockholm. Möjlighet till hybridarbete erbjuds.
 



  





 Meridion grundades 2005 och vi är idag 35 personer med en spännande tillväxtresa framför oss.
 



  





 För oss är vår laganda och företagskultur otroligt viktigt och ligger oss varmt om hjärtat. Alla medarbetare hos oss blir en viktig del i vårt team för vår fortsatta tillväxt med nya spännande uppdrag, peppiga personalaktiviteter och för att vi tillsammans har en rolig vardag.
 



  





**Om tjänsten** 




 Hos oss kommer du att få lära dig konsultyrket från grunden och få gedigen erfarenhet i hur nya affärsprocesser designas och implementeras. Under din första tid kommer du fokusera på utbildning både internt av våra egna experter där fokus ligger på vår projektmodell, konsultyrket och Meridions strategier, samt externa utbildningar via våra partners för att lära dig programvaran Infor M3.
 



  





 Därefter gäller praktisk applicering och att komma in i projekt tillsammans med kollegor. Tanken är att få samarbeta med så många som möjligt på kontoret och fokusera på att utvecklas i din nya roll som konsult. Du kommer primärt jobba i projektform i ett team av Meridionkonsulter för att exempelvis implementera M3 Cloud som affärssystem i en fabrik.
 



  





 Du kommer att jobba tätt tillsammans med våra affärskonsulter där vi uppskattar att du är nytänkande och tänker utanför boxen för att hitta de bästa lösningarna för våra kunder. Våra kunder som vi också hoppas du gladeligen har en tät dialog med om lösningar och önskemål.
 



  





 Utbildningarna som ges via Infor ger en bred överblick över de olika områdena i M3 för att du ska kunna hitta din nisch:
 


* Affärskonsult där man kan välja sitt områden inom t.ex. kundorderhantering, produktion, lager eller inköpshantering.
* Finanskonsult, vilket passar dig som har en högskoleutbildning inom finans och vill jobba mer tekniskt.
* Teknisk affärskonsult där man kommer att arbeta med systemintegration eller utveckling/kodning av kundanpassningar och appar. Även här är processutveckling en del av allt vi gör.



  





**Om dig** 




 Vi ser att du är nyexaminerad inom industriell ekonomi, logistik, systemvetenskap eller liknande. Du är nyfiken, har en stark inlärningsvilja och är orädd för att testa dig fram. Teknik intresserar dig och du är beredd att ta dig an tekniska utmaningar. Stor vikt kommer läggas på dina personliga egenskaper.
 



  






 Välkommen med din ansökan genom att maila in ditt CV och personliga brev till 
 
 jobb@meridion.se

title: Client Delivery Manager
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Software Development
description:
**Imagine something you can do today that you couldn’t do in the past – like paying for groceries without opening your wallet. Extenda Retail is a market-leading company with extensive retail and logistics knowledge. Our innovations touch everyday lives. Join a company that simplifies shopping and inspires retailers and logistics businesses to go further.** 




  





 Our Cloud native POS-system, Hii (High Intensity Intelligent) Retail, is a powerful checkout solution designed for Fast-Moving Consumer Goods. It enables Unified Commerce at scale, offering an open architecture and APIs for rapid implementation and seamless, personalized customer experiences. Whether in physical stores, online, or across both, Hii Retail ensures consistency and efficiency across all channels, delivering the flexibility and performance retailers need to thrive.
 



  





**About the role** 




  





**We are looking for a driven and experienced Client Delivery Manager** 
 to play a crucial role in managing the successful delivery of our software solutions. To succeed in this role you should be passionate about leading complex software implementations for top-tier international clients. Our delivery portfolio spans from proof of concept to large multi-year programs, managing packaged software service deliveries or SaaS implementations.
 



  





 In this role, you will be accountable for planning and coordinating deliveries across one or more development teams, both local and sourced out globally through partners. You'll collaborate closely with our clients' representatives to ensure alignment with their requirements and provide regular progress updates. This requires strong cross-functional collaboration skills and the ability to work effectively with multiple teams. Your focus will be on coordinating system deliveries with highest quality, speed and client satisfaction. You will also partner with Client Executives/Client Success Managers to ensure profitable deliveries.
 



  





**Earlier Experience** 




  





 You probably bring 5+ years of project management experience, ideally within a product-centric, agile environment. Experience with cloud-based software deliveries is highly advantageous. You should be comfortable taking a holistic view of the delivery while also having the ability to delve into technical details when necessary and quickly establish credibility with clients, stakeholders, and our technical teams. You will also need a strong commercial mindset and understanding of the business aspects of software deliveries. Experience as a service manager responsible for continuous delivery of maintenance, support, and enhancements will also help you in this position as maintaining the quality and service levels for existing products is to the clients is an important aspect of this role.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 




  




* Responsible for the overall client delivery.
* Responsible for managing client expectations and relationships.
* Responsible for budget and profit/loss for the delivery.
* Monitors and manages financials, schedule, and scope to ensure the delivery stays on track.
* Coordinate deliveries across multiple engineering teams.
* Manage progress, risks and issues with teams, clients, and stakeholders.
* Understands the Extenda Retail Methodology and possesses the ability to assess risks in process, people, or technology and adjusts plans to address accordingly.
* Facilitates and leads status meetings with team, sponsors, and all stakeholders.
* Continuously focus on improving ways of working. Inspect and adapt.
* Facilitate a collaborative, open and transparent environment.
* Proactively communicate with clients and stakeholders.



  





**Skills And Experience** 




  




* 5+ years of project management experience, managing and delivering software product solutions from inception to delivery to client.
* Clear and compelling communication skills in order to tune your message depending on who the audience is.
* Demonstrate a variety of leadership; technical, commercial and interpersonal skills.
* Experience from software delivery using Agile methodologies.
* Experience in professional services/consulting organization.
* Highly analytical and data driven.
* University degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience.
* Working knowledge of software development
* Certified knowledge and experience of at least one formal project management methodology.
* Fluent in Swedish, both verbal and written



  





 Sounds interesting? Do you have what it takes? Be sure to apply as soon as possible.
 



  





**Location** 




  





 Stockholm

title: AWS/GCP Expertised Data Engineer
description:
**Job Title: Data Engineer/SW Developer with GCP/AWS Expertise** 




**About the Role** 




 Seeking an experienced Software Developer to enhance data collection, streaming, and automation using AWS and VisFlow.
 



**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Develop and optimize AWS-based solutions (EC2, S3, Lambda, Glue, Redshift, Kinesis) and/or corresponding GCP Technologies.
* Enhance VisFlow’s data automation and orchestration.
* Build CI/CD pipelines (GitLab) and manage infrastructure (Terraform/CloudFormation).
* Ensure cloud security, scalability, and performance.



**Required Skills:** 



* 5+ years in software development (Python, C++).
* Strong AWS expertise.
* CI/CD, GitLab, Docker, Kubernetes.
* Unix/Linux, SQL, and networking basics.
* Databricks is an advantage.



 Following stack is what we use:
 


* Custom Connectors: Airbyte, Apache NiFi
* Data Integration & Transformation: DBT, RDF & Knowledge Graphs, Apache Jena, LangChain
* Data Streaming: Apache Kafka, Apache Flink
* Business Rules Engine: Gorules/Drools
* Code Quality: SonarQube, others
* Orchestration Tools: Apache Airflow, Kubeflow
* Data Storage & Formats: PostgreSQL, Apache Iceberg, Apache Hudi, Parquet & Avro
* Distributed Data Processing: Apache Spark (PySpark), Apache Flink, Dask
* Version Control & CI/CD: Git, GitLab CI/CD, GitHub Actions
* Monitoring: Prometheus, Graphana, ELK
* Containerization & DevOps: Infrastructure as Code (IaC) with Github Actions playbook
* Data Governance & Lineage: DataHub, OpenLineage
* Data Privacy & Security: Open Policy Agent (OPA), Apache Ranger, Hashicorp Vault
* Data Query Engines: Trino (formerly Presto), Apache Hive



**Nice to Have:** 



* Apache Airflow, Kafka, frontend experience.
* Data Quality & Validation: Great Expectations
* Machine Learning: PyTorch, Hugging Face Transformers, Haystack, FAISS/ Weaviate, Ray Train & Ray Serve, OpenAI Enterprise API, DeepSpeed, LangChain
* AWS certifications/GCP



**What We Offer:** 



* Competitive salary & benefits.
* Work on cutting-edge AWS/GCP technologies.
* Career growth in an innovative team.
* Join us and shape the future of cloud automation with AWS & VisFlow!

title: Senior Solutions Architect
description:
**Description**
 Automat-it is an all-in AWS Premier partner that empowers startups with DevOps and FinOps expertise and hands-on services. We guide and support hundreds of startups leveraging AWS smarter throughout their growth journey. We save our customers significant time to market and optimize their cloud performance and cost-effectiveness.
   

  

 Automat-it operates in more than seven countries across EMEA. We provide a dynamic environment where you can expand your professional expertise and make a significant impact.
   

  

 In this position as Senior Solutions Architect, you will be a crucial member of the pre-sales process, working with account managers to develop AWS solutions for our startup customers.
   

  

 📍 Work location - Remote within Amsterdam or Stockholm.
   

  

 ✈️ Travel Requirements: 20%.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Design, develop, and implement solutions to meet business requirements and create cost-efficient, highly available, and scalable solutions for customers, including Well-Architected reviews and SoW.
* Research and analyze current solutions and initiate improvement plans.
* Collaborate with other engineers and stakeholders to ensure solutions are designed and developed according to best practices.
* Share your knowledge with our customers and the cloud community by participating in public speaking engagements such as workshops, conferences, webinars, and more.
* Frequent travels - locally (on-demand to meet with customers and partners and attend local events) and abroad (at least once a quarter).


**Requirements**
* 3+ years of hands-on experience in an AWS environment, including implementation, migration, and maintenance, designing solutions end-to-end
* 2+ years of experience in technical customer-facing roles, such as Customer Engineering, SRE, Cloud Architect, or equivalent
* 2+ years of experience in an IT environment, including hands-on in Kubernetes, CI/CD, and DevOps tools - advantage
* Proven experience in a production environment, developing software with either Python, Go, Java, or equivalents
* In-depth knowledge of AWS's main services, with an emphasis on Kubernetes and Containers
* Successfully designed DevOps and Infrastructure for high-scale production environments in AWS
* Understanding of Information Security best practices
* Certified AWS Solutions Architect - Associate.
* AWS Solutions Architect Professional or a specialty certification - an advantage
* Ability to effectively communicate technical design in verbal and written formats in front of customers
* Ability to lead an end-to-end engagement with the account management team
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment


 Automat-it is committed to fostering a workplace that promotes equal opportunities for all and believes that a diverse workforce is crucial to our success. Our recruitment decisions are based on your experience and skills, recognizing the value you bring to our team.

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
As a Machine Learning Engineer at Fortum, you will develop cutting-edge AI solutions and contribute to a clean energy future. This is your chance to be part of a dynamic team that is passionate about leveraging data to drive innovations in sustainable energy. You will work on new projects, utilizing advanced analytics to solve complex problems and optimize energy solutions. Your work will directly impact our mission to create a cleaner world, and you will play a key role in shaping the future of energy. Join us and be part of something bigger.
   

  

**About The Role**
 At Fortum, we value creativity, collaboration, and the power of data-driven decision-making. You will have the opportunity to develop your skills in a supportive environment, with access to the latest tools and technologies. We offer competitive compensation packages, professional growth opportunities, and the satisfaction of knowing your efforts are contributing to a sustainable future for generations to come. If you are ready to make a difference and embrace the challenge of transforming the energy landscape, Fortum is the place for you. Join Fortum’s Data Science & Optimization team to play a key role in our digitalization and AI journey. Together with a multi-disciplinary team of designers, developers, data scientists and testers, you will work with rapid digital experimentation to prove technical feasibility and usability of new AI use cases.
   

  

 Main responsibilities will include but not be limited to:
   

  

  

* Design and implement AI and ML solutions in Fortum’s cloud environments (both Azure and AWS) that are robust, scalable, secure and cost-efficient
* Design and automate stable MLOps pipelines with model re-training
* Contribute to best practices development in AI solutions and MLOps
* Communicate with diverse stakeholders and understand the business needs
* Discuss and design interfaces with backend and frontend teams
* Discuss requirements for storage and data maintenance protocols with DevOps, CloudOps, EA architecture and cybersecurity functions
* Coach the team and be open to learn about the energy domain


 The position can either be based in Sweden and Solna or Finland and Espoo.
   

  

**About You**
 To thrive in this role, you should have an MSc degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent work experience. A strong background in Machine Learning and MLOps is essential, with at least three years of solid experience in software engineering using Python. You must also be proficient in statistics and data science, having spent a minimum of two years honing these skills. Experience working with cloud solutions, particularly Azure and/or AWS, for over two years is necessary. You should also have a keen interest in the latest AI developments.
   

  

  

* Experience with GenAI, cloud AI services, and different solution concepts (e.g. RAG, model fine-tuning, prompt engineering).
* Familiarity with GitHub Actions service deployment, containers and DevOps practices.
* Excellent communication skills and interest to learn about the energy domain.
* Full professional proficiency in written and oral English.


 Preferred additional experience includes:
   

  

  

* Data engineering; architecture development and deployment.
* IT security, high availability, cybersecurity, maintenance and support.
* Data storage and data maintenance methods.
* Familiarity with message brokers and microservice architectures.
* Basic knowledge of OCPP, MQTT, and IOT devices.
* Experience in working in an Agile environment.


**We offer you**
 At Fortum, we believe in a better future and want to be involved in shaping it. Our workplace is a safe place, both physically and mentally. You will grow with professional colleagues, being trusted and free to challenge yourself. We offer comprehensive benefits, flexible working hours, and hybrid work model to support your productivity, development and wellbeing. We are committed to build diverse teams where everyone feels included and is treated equally.
   

  

 More information about our culture and benefits can be found here.
   

  

**Interested?**
 Please submit your application by 2025-03-23 at the latest. We will process the applications continually, and the position will be filled as soon as the right candidate is found, which may be before the last application deadline, so please apply as soon as possible.If you have any questions regarding the process or the position, please contact Kristofer Jakobsson, Head of Data Science & Optimization, kristofer.jakobson@fortum.com.
   

  

 To be selected for the position, the applicant must go through background clearance, as well as a health examination which may include a drug test.
   

  

**We are Fortum**
 Fortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our :5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com

title: Salesforce Administrator
description:
Svea Solar is one of Europe's fastest-growing energy-tech companies, with over 50,000 customers and more than 10 years of experience. We offer smart software and hardware that create value for homeowners, businesses, and large solar parks.
   

  

 As we continue our journey and drive innovation in the energy field, we are now looking for a dedicated
 **Salesforce Administrator** 
 to join our CRM department!
   

  

 The role
   

  

 As a Salesforce Administrator, you play a key role in keeping our Salesforce platform running smoothly. You work closely with different departments to make sure Salesforce is configured to meet business needs and help users get the most out of the system. You’ll have a lot of freedom and responsibility, and the chance to work in dialogue with many different parts of our business. It’s a great opportunity to collaborate with various teams. There are also many areas to explore, and you can take the chance to lead projects based on your own interests.
   

  

 You will report directly to our Head of Group CRM , Jonny Karlsson.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Manage and support Salesforce users – create accounts, assign permissions, and troubleshoot issues.
* Ensure data integrity by managing duplicates, enforcing validation rules, and maintaining clean records.
* Build and maintain reports and dashboards to provide teams with relevant insights.
* Configure and optimize Salesforce – update page layouts, fields, and workflows to improve usability.
* Automate processes using Flows to streamline daily operations.
* Train and support users by providing guidance on best practices and troubleshooting common issues.
* Collaborate with stakeholders across sales, customer service, and other teams to refine Salesforce processes.
* Stay up to date on Salesforce updates and proactively suggest improvements to enhance system efficiency.


 Are we a match?
   

  

 We believe you align with our values and are a curious person who enjoys learning and taking on responsibility. You have hands-on experience managing
 **Salesforce** 
 and supporting users in a structured and collaborative way. You’re eager to solve problems, streamline processes, and help teams make the most of Salesforce.
   

  

* 1-2 years’ experience working with Salesforce.
* Comfortable with user management, creating reports, and building dashboards.
* Basic understanding of data management (e.g., de-duplication and validation rules).
* Strong communication skills and the ability to support both technical and non-technical teams.
* Fluent in English (other languages are a bonus).


**Nice to Have:**
* Experience with automation tools like Flows or Process Builder.
* Knowledge of Salesforce features like Field Service or Experience Cloud.
* Familiarity with integrations or third-party tools.


 At Svea Solar, we believe in a collaboration-first mindset, which is why we would love for you to work from our office as much as possible.
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

 At Svea Solar, we promote diversity and inclusion, as different perspectives drive innovation. Here, you will have the opportunity to grow professionally and contribute to the energy solutions of the future. As part of our team, you will play an important role in "The Power Shift" towards a greener future, focusing on teamwork, growth, and a fun working environment. 🌱🌞
   

  

**Svea Solar – More Than Just Solar Panels**
 Svea Solar is not only a leader in solar panel installations, but we also aim to be a long-term energy partner for our customers. We offer a broad product portfolio with smart solutions that enable our customers to optimize their energy usage. Our offerings include
 **heat pumps in collaboration with IKEA** 
 , electric vehicle chargers, batteries, electricity contracts, and our own
 **energy optimization software (VPP)** 
 . We are continuously working to develop new solutions that make a difference — both for our customers and for the climate.
   

  

**Application**
* We will start reviewing applications immediately, so don’t wait to apply!
* On this page, you will find more information about our recruitment processes.
* For the final candidate, we conduct a background check on criminal records.


 If you have any questions about the role, feel free to contact our recruiter, Linnea, at linnea.strand@sveasolar.com.

title: Product Marketing Lead
description:
**Xensam: SAM Disrupters** 




 Xensam is the leading provider of AI-powered, cloud-hosted Software Asset Management technology. We’re looking for key players to join us as we scale our impact and build the Xensam team together. We take our culture seriously and strive to maintain the excellence, energy & enthusiasm that flows through the organization today.
 



  





 We look for candidates who are passionate about what they do and ready to work the Xensam way. We know that experience counts, but we also know that it’s you, the person behind the experience, that makes it count.
 



  





**About the role** 




 Are you a master storyteller who can transform complex technology into compelling customer value? As the guardian of our product positioning, you'll shape how we communicate the value of our fast-growing Software Asset Management platform to the world.
 



  





 As our Product Marketing Lead at Xensam, you'll be the storyteller who bridges our R&D innovations with customer needs. Working within our dynamic marketing team and reporting to the CMO, you'll own our product narrative across all channels.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 



* Guard our product positioning to ensure consistent product messaging in collaboration with R&D and marketing teams.
* Craft compelling content that transforms technical features into business value.
* Drive product launch campaigns and regular release communications across multiple channels.
* Design lifecycle marketing messages within product notifications and communications.
* Conduct market research and customer interviews to shape our narrative.
* Transform technical documentation into customer-friendly communications.
* Co-create brand awareness campaigns for product positioning.



  





**Qualifications** 



* 2-3 years of product marketing experience, ideally in B2B SaaS.
* Bachelor in marketing, business or tech, with additional education (course, certification, or diploma) in writing.
* Exceptional writing skills in English with the ability to simplify complex technical concepts.
* Strong analytical capabilities for market and customer insights.
* Proactive approach and structured working style.
* Excellence in cross-functional collaboration and stakeholder management.



  





**Bonus points if you have** 



* Technical writing background.
* Confidence in front of the camera for video content.
* Presentation and webinar experience.
* Previous experience in Software or SaaS Asset Management.



  





**What you get** 



* A dynamic position embracing "freedom under responsibility".
* Three days in-office (with remote work on Mondays and Fridays).
* Free access to beverages, snacks, gym facilities, on-site massage, shuffleboard, and other games.
* If sales targets are met, all employees enjoy an annual destination trip.
* Join an ambitious and diverse team, and work with cutting-edge technology in the fastest-growing SAM software on the market.
* An opportunity to shape your career growth while contributing to the company’s success.



  





**At Xensam, our core values define our culture** 




**Rebellious** 
 : We encourage a spirit of freedom and initiative within responsibility.
 



**Humane** 
 : We foster a caring, inclusive environment that values diversity and respects individuality.
 



**Harmonious** 
 : We promote work-life balance, creating a pleasant, supportive workplace.
 



 Ready to own our product story?
 **Apply now with your resume and a writing sample that showcases your ability to transform technical concepts into compelling narratives.** 




  





 As part of our recruitment process, we conduct background checks on final candidates to fulfill our commitments to customers and ensure a safe work environment.

title: Senior systemadministratör till Sveriges nationella CSIRT
description:
**Myndigheten för samhällsskydd och beredskap**
 MSB arbetar för ett säkrare samhälle i en föränderlig värld. Vi stärker Sveriges förmåga att fungera i kris och till och med krig. Det betyder att alla våra medarbetare bidrar till ett land där människor är beredda: Från norr till söder sprider vi kunskap och agerar för att skydda liv och hälsa, samhällets funktionalitet och grundläggande värden som demokrati, rättssäkerhet och mänskliga rättigheter.
   

  

 Vill du bidra till ett säkrare samhälle? Då är du kanske vår nästa kollega på CERT-SE – Sveriges nationella CSIRT med uppgift att hantera och förebygga it-säkerhetsincidenter och cyberangrepp.
   

  

**Ditt ansvar och dina arbetsuppgifter**
 Vårt uppdrag på enheten för tekniska resurser är att förse CERT-SE med de tekniska system och verktyg som krävs för att effektivt kunna hantera och förebygga it-säkerhetsincidenter och cyberangrepp. Vi står just nu inför spännande utvidgning av vår it-miljö med hänsyn till krav i NIS2 samt kommande integration i det nationella cybersäkerhetscentret.
   

  

 Som systemadministratör ingår du i ett kompetent och engagerat team som säkerställer att it-miljö och applikationer uppfyller verksamhetens behov och säkerhetskrav.
   

  

 I rollen som senior systemadministratör kommer du tillsammans med teamet ansvara för utveckling och administration av CERT-SE interna it-infrastruktur. Arbetsuppgifterna innefattar bland annat:
   

  

* kontinuerliga förbättringar av infrastrukturen
* felsökning och rättningar
* härdning av system
* livscykelhantering
* dokumentation


 Utöver det medverkar du i planering, uppföljning och analys av hela vår it-miljö samt stödjer verksamheten i tekniska frågor.
   

  

 CERT-SE erbjuder goda möjligheter till kompetensutveckling genom utbildning, övningar, extern samverkan och kunskapsutbyte både inom och utanför Sverige. Det finns på sikt även möjlighet att delta i CERT-SE operativa analysarbete tillsammans med våra it-säkerhetsspecialister. CERT-SE deltar årligen i flertalet nationella och internationella cyberövningar. Du kommer att ha möjlighet att delta i dessa övningar och CTF:er för att utveckla både din och vår förmåga.
   

  

**Dina kunskaper och kompetenser**
 Vi söker dig som har minst fem års dokumenterad arbetslivserfarenhet av drift- och underhåll av Linuxbaserade miljöer och open source-applikationer. Du har högt säkerhetsmedvetande och har tidigare arbetat med:
   

  

* Underhåll, utveckling och härdning av Linux-system
* Automatisering och versionshantering
* Lokal it-drift


 Det är meriterande om du har:
   

  

* Identitetstjänster
* Nätverk
* SELinux
* Python
* PKI


 Som alla medarbetare och ledare hos oss förväntas du kunna arbeta uppdragsorienterat, utvecklingsinriktat, dialoginriktat, ha god självkännedom och bidra genom att vara ett föredöme.
   

  

 Arbetet innebär mycket samarbete inom och utanför teamet. Därför ser vi även att du har lätt för att arbeta både självständigt och i grupp och har god kommunikationsförmåga i tal och skrift på svenska. Vi kommer lägga stor vikt läggas på personliga egenskaper.
   

  

**Om anställningen**
 Vi erbjuder dig en anställning tillsvidare på heltid som inleds med en provanställning. Din placeringsort kommer att vara Stockholm på vårt kontor Tomteboda, och resor i anställningen förekommer.
   

  

 Svenskt medborgarskap är ett krav för anställning på MSB då den innebär placering i säkerhetsklass. För anställning krävs godkänt resultat i säkerhetsprövningen med registerkontroll, som genomförs i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Anställningen är placerad i Verksamheten för operativ cybersäkerhet på enheten för tekniska resurser. Enheten för tekniska resurser är en av enheterna på CERT-SE, Sveriges nationella CSIRT (Computer Security Incident Repsonse Team). I enhetens uppgifter ingår att drifta, förvalta och vidareutveckla de it-system och applikationer som verksamheten inom CERT-SE har behov av för att uppfylla sina uppdrag som nationell CSIRT.
   

  

 CERT-SE är en nationell funktion som har i uppdrag att stödja samhället i arbetet med att förebygga och hantera it-incidenter och andra cyberangrepp. CERT-SE har tekniskt fokus mot masspåverkande cyberhot, sårbarheter i vanligt förekommande produkter samt mot specifika hot av allvarlig natur. Detta i syfte att bidra till skydd av samhällsviktiga funktioner och digitala tjänster samt för samhället i stort. CERT-SE är Sveriges kontaktpunkt för cybersäkerhet gentemot motsvarande funktioner i andra länder.
   

  

 CERT-SE har inlett en ny fas i sin utveckling. Samverkan med det nationella cybersäkerhetscentret NCSC-SE har intensifierats och på sikt kommer CERT-SE att överföras till NCSC-SE. Samtidigt förväntas CERT-SE öka sina förmågor och ge stöd till fler delar av samhället. För att lyckas med det behöver vi stärka vårt team och rekrytera nya, kunniga och engagerade medarbetare till existerande och nya roller i verksamheten.
   

  

 Alla vi som arbetar på MSB förväntas och ska bidra till ökad jämställdhet och likabehandling för en arbetsmiljö och ett samhälle fritt från diskriminering.
   

  

**Vill du veta mer?**
 Har du frågor är du välkommen att kontakta enhetschef Helen Henningsson. Facklig företrädare är Carl Önne SACO-S, Jan Herremo ST och Ann-Britt Paradis eller Leif Fröhlen SEKO. Samtliga nås via växelnumret 0771-240 240.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan senast den 30 mars 2025!**
 Det är du som sökande som ska dokumentera och påvisa din kompetens på ett sätt som medger en saklig, kvalitativ bedömning. Du ska också vara medveten om att de ansökningshandlingar som lämnas till MSB är offentliga allmänna handlingar vilket innebär att var och en har rätt att ta del av dem.
   

  

**Anställningsform** 
 Tillsvidare med provanställning
   

  

**Anställningen avslutas** 
 -0001-11-30
   

  

**Anställningens omfattning** 
 Heltid
   

  

**Tillträde** 
 Enligt överenskommelse
   

  

**Löneform** 
 Enligt överenskommelse
   

  

**Antal lediga befattningar** 
 1
   

  

**Sysselsättningsgrad** 
 100%
   

  

**Ort** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**Län** 
 Stockholms län
   

  

**Land** 
 Sverige
   

  

**Referensnummer** 
 2025/43
   

  

**Publicerat** 
 2025-03-05
   

  

**Sista ansökningsdag** 
 2025-03-30
   

  

**Dela länkar**

title: RAN Robustness Verification Engineer
description:
Join our Team
   

  

**About this opportunity:**
 Predicting the future is fun! Creating it is powerful! We do both. Ericsson technologies open endless possibilities across industries as a front runner and as technology leader.
   

  

 It is our responsibility to secure the quality of Ericsson’s Radio Access Networks (RAN) software against the most exacting customers’ expectations, in the most challenging development context. We integrate the latest 5G and One Open RAN features for high-capacity wireless networks. We integrate and verify 5G and One Open RAN Use Cases to the high standards of demanding customers. Enabling and maintaining Ericsson’s technology and market leadership is our purpose.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Drive, implement and prioritize quality assurance requirements in the 5G and One Open RAN product area with focus on Robustness.
* Contribute to the design of the Robustness test architecture. Integrate and test RAN features.
* Analyze Ericsson RAN product with respect to Robustness and In-Service Performance requirements.
* Secure Ericsson bi-weekly releases of 5G RAN products in Live networks.
* Identify teams, way of working, environment problems and propose solutions to solve them.
* Strive for customer focus and on time delivery.
* Collaborate with colleagues in different sites: Sweden, Poland, China & Croatia.


**The skills you bring:**
* 3 to 5 years’ experience in integration and verification in 5G Radio Access Network technologies.
* MSc or higher education level in Electrical Engineering, Computer Sciences, AI/ML, or equivalent domain.
* Cloud RAN experience.
* Used to handle complex troubleshooting.
* Excellent team working ability. Ability to work independently, support other team members, and receive support when needed.
* The ability to be a role model for the team.
* Proficiency in English.
* Analytic ability, creativity, and drive.
* Drive improvements: detect gaps and initiate changes to fill them.
* Be flexible and customer oriented with international teams.


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 759318

title: Senior Systems Engineer - HPE Aruba
description:
This role has been designed as ‘Hybrid’ with an expectation that you will work on average 2-3 days per week from an HPE office.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 Hewlett Packard Enterprise is the global edge-to-cloud company advancing the way people live and work. We help companies connect, protect, analyze, and act on their data and applications wherever they live, from edge to cloud, so they can turn insights into outcomes at the speed required to thrive in today’s complex world. Our culture thrives on finding new and better ways to accelerate what’s next. We know diverse backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good. If you are looking to stretch and grow your career our culture will embrace you. Open up opportunities with HPE.
   

  

**Job Description**
 As a
 **Senior Systems Engineer** 
 at HPE Aruba Networking you act as a technical expert and enable portfolio knowledge and execution. Your ability to combine technical know-how and market intelligence grants you a position as an ambassador and technical expert. You will be the driving force behind the overall portfolio knowledge in all dimensions within your assigned customer territory.
   

  

**Client/customer Relationship**
* Maintain excellent communications with customers and partners in assigned customer or expertise area (mainly in public sector)
* Represents HPE Aruba as a technical expert in customer and partner meetings, forums or other events
* Drives opportunities with effective consultative techniques
* Builds customer loyalty through becoming a trusted advisor
* Partners effectively with others in the account team to ensure customer satisfaction
* The role will require business travels in Sweden (around 1-3 days/week)


**Solution Planning And Design**
* Building a strong technical expertise within certain areas of the Aruba portfolio
* Develop a good understanding of the overall Aruba portfolio
* Acquire at least one Aruba Expert certification
* Adapt proposal and design to customer requirements
* Establishes the validity of a solution and its components
* Identifies the growth path and scalability options of a solution for long term architectural positioning
* Articulate and clarify key aspects to implementation plans and setting expectations


**Team Collaboration**
* You are a team player who actively supports the account team with solution advice, proposals, presentations, and other customer communications.
* Analyzes and provides support to deals in the pipeline where needed.
* Transfers knowledge to peers via mentoring and actively participation in education programs.
* Understands the roles and effectively engages other teams and resources within the company and partners.
* Facilitates a smooth transition from sales to implementation projects and design


 If you are…
   

  

* Fluent in Swedish and English which are the 2 working languages
* Holding an Engineering or University degree or extensive experience in designing and supporting complex enterprise networks
* Ideally having at least 3-6 years’ experience on the Solution Architect/System Engineer/Presales role, mainly acquired with a manufacturer and/or an integrator
* Excellent in communication, presentation and negotiation
* Having good knowledge on Aruba's latest technologies and solutions, as well as competitive solutions
* Able to understand technical innovations and trends, customer value chains and business requirements


 Join us and make your mark!
   

  

**Additional Skills**
 Accountability, Accountability, Active Learning (Inactive), Active Listening, Assertiveness, Bias, Building Rapport, Buyer Personas, Coaching, Complex Sales, Creativity, Critical Thinking, Cross-Functional Teamwork, Customer Experience Strategy, Customer Interactions, Design Thinking, Empathy, Financial Acumen, Follow-Through, Growth Mindset, Identifying Sales Opportunities, Industry Knowledge, Intellectual Curiosity (Inactive), Long Term Planning, Managing Ambiguity {+ 6 more}
   

  

**What We Can Offer You**
**Health & Wellbeing**
 We strive to provide our team members and their loved ones with a comprehensive suite of benefits that supports their physical, financial and emotional wellbeing.
   

  

**Personal & Professional Development**
 We also invest in your career because the better you are, the better we all are. We have specific programs catered to helping you reach any career goals you have — whether you want to become a knowledge expert in your field or apply your skills to another division.
   

  

**Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging**
 We are unconditionally inclusive in the way we work and celebrate individual uniqueness. We know diverse backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good.
   

  

**Let's Stay Connected**
 Follow @HPECareers on Instagram to see the latest on people, culture and tech at HPE.
   

  

 #sweden
   

  

 #aruba
   

  

**Job**
 Sales
   

  

**Job Level**
 TCP\_04
   

  

 HPE is an Equal Employment Opportunity/ Veterans/Disabled/LGBT and Affirmative Action employer. We are committed to diversity and building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We do not discriminate and all decisions we make are made on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. Our goal is to be one global diverse team that is representative of our customers, in an inclusive environment where we can continue to innovate and grow together. Please click here: Equal Employment Opportunity.
   

  

**Hewlett Packard Enterprise is EEO F/M/Protected Veteran/ Individual with Disabilities.**
 HPE will comply with all applicable laws related to employer use of arrest and conviction records, including laws requiring employers to consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories.

title: Inside Sales Specialist - Cloud
description:
**Why Choose TD SYNNEX:**
 As a
 **Fortune 500 global corporation** 
 , operating in over 100 countries, TD SYNNEX values its diverse workforce of 22,000 employees. As the biggest IT distributor in the world, our mission is to provide top-notch technology solutions, empowering businesses and individuals to navigate the digital world safely and efficiently.
   

  

**About the role:**
 As an
 **Inside Sales Specialist,** 
 you will join the sales team
 **within Cloud** 
 . You’ll build Excellent customer and vendor sales relationships through proactive engagement and demonstrable specialist product knowledge under supervision.
   

  

**What you'll do:**
* Generate new business opportunities by planning outbound calls to customers and can have a general conversation around a solution/product area
* Achieve monthly/quarterly Revenue and Margin targets
* Proactively develop relationships with key internal and external contacts
* Drives sales of specific products/ vendors if specific knowledge is required
* Provides accurate and timely quotations
* Generate and own a pipeline of deals in TD SYNNEX’s CRM system, which is regularly reviewed and updated and ensure active closure of opportunities
* Manage customer backorder expectations and reporting
* Ensure CRM system is well maintained and provides correct customer information
* Provide, sell and negotiate product information, pricing, special offers and promotions


**What we're kindly looking for:**
* 1-2 years of experience in Sales.
* Fluent in English and Swedish.
* Numerate with good attention to detail
* Excellent telephone manner
* Priority management and planning skills
* Strive to achieve set targets


**What We Offer:**
 We provide competitive compensation with
 **annual salary reviews.**
**Hybrid work** 
 - (3 days at the office, 2 days at home)
   

  

 We value continuous learning and provide a clear progression plan.
   

  

 We provide
 **comprehensive benefits** 
 including
 **health insurance** 
 , paid leave, retirement plans, and more.
   

  

**Key Skills**
**What’s In It For You?**
* Elective Benefits: Our programs are tailored to your country to best accommodate your lifestyle.
* Grow Your Career: Accelerate your path to success (and keep up with the future) with formal programs on leadership and professional development, and many more on-demand courses.
* Elevate Your Personal Well-Being: Boost your financial, physical, and mental well-being through seminars, events, and our global Life Empowerment Assistance Program.
* Diversity, Equity & Inclusion: It’s not just a phrase to us; valuing every voice is how we succeed. Join us in celebrating our global diversity through inclusive education, meaningful peer-to-peer conversations, and equitable growth and development opportunities.
* Make the Most of our Global Organization: Network with other new co-workers within your first 30 days through our onboarding program.
* Connect with Your Community: Participate in internal, peer-led inclusive communities and activities, including business resource groups, local volunteering events, and more environmental and social initiatives.


**Don’t meet every single requirement? Apply anyway.**
 At TD SYNNEX, we’re proud to be recognized as a great place to work and a leader in the promotion and practice of diversity, equity and inclusion. If you’re excited about working for our company and believe you’re a good fit for this role, we encourage you to apply. You may be exactly the person we’re looking for!

title: Test Engineer - ABB Process Automation
description:
**Test Engineer - ABB Process Automation**
==========================================

#### **At ABB, we are dedicated to addressing global challenges. Our core values: care, courage, curiosity, and collaboration - combined with a focus on diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunities - are key drivers in our aim to empower everyone to create sustainable solutions. That's our story. Make it your story.**

### **Your role and responsibilities**


We are looking for a Test Engineer for electronics to start working as part of our Process Control Platform (PCP), a unit within ABB’s business area Process Automation. PCP develops automation products - hardware and software - for monitoring, process control and optimization. We have automation products for all kind of industries. As a Test Engineer for electronics, you will be responsible for monitoring, challenging and increasing ABB supplier’s production performance mostly in product testing area by developing ABB products testing solutions and adopting those to industry producibility standards. Key interaction areas are maintaining and controlling ABB production test equipment at our suppliers (working in TestStand, understanding ABB product communication and supporting creation and acceptance of various testers (programming, ICT, Hi-Pot, functional test), monitoring suppliers performance and working together with them to increase it, collaboration with other ABB functions to launch and ramp-up production at Electronic Manufacturing Services (EMS) plants (ex. participating in quality audits, driving NPI (new product introduction) process, etc., challenging suppliers in cost optimization, working with EMS companies to ensure continuous production flow and non-disrupted process and operations). Examples of responsibilities include: • Driving test equipment development, ordering and validation process • Product test specification reviews with R&D (preferred) • Coaching suppliers about ABB production requirements, as well as supporting the internal R&D department with production test strategy, plan and procedures • Following design guidelines and standards (design for excellence criteria) • Controlling investment for new/updated products • Working in close collaboration with Supplier Quality, R&D, Planning and Fulfillment team, Procurement and Logistics teams • ABB asset database management • Support continuous improvement projects at EMS • Following Lean Six Sigma as the leading principle Test Engineer for electronics is a key element in PCP hardware value chain to drive quality and performance of technical solution and production, hence a key element to positive business development and customer satisfaction. Join us in this position and help us on this development journey!


### **Qualifications for the role**

* Around 3 years of experience in hardware development or Test engineer for electronics, Test Engineering or Test Design at EMS
* Knowledge in hardware design and production processes
* Basic knowledge of LabView and/or TestStand is preferrable
* Professional expertise in Electronic Manufacturing Services (EMS) or introduction of new products in mass production, or similar
* Good communication skills and a team player
* Good oral and written English
* Strong quality mindset – with a strive for perfection and an open and global mindset
* Knowledge of IPC electronics standards is beneficial

### **More about us**


Recruiting Manager Martynas Gedgaudas, +37 066 54 86 13, will answer your questions about the position. Union representatives - Sveriges Ingenjörer: Mikael Blomqvist, +46 768 06 00 11; Ledarna: Leif Öhrberg, +46 724 64 40 16; Unionen: Krista Andersson, +46 706 44 02 85. Talent Partner: Johannes Westermark Hester. We value people from different backgrounds. Could this be your story? Apply today or visit www.abb.com to read more about us and learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe. #MyABBStory Apply at the latest by 9th March. Please note that interviews are held on an ongoing basis, apply today to secure your spot in the recruitment process! Please note that, to be eligible for employment at ABB AB, you will need to pass our pre-employment screening steps. This includes a reference check, a drug test and could also include a background check. We kindly decline any direct contact with staffing and recruitment agencies as well as sellers of additional job advertisements.
company_description: ABB is a leading global technology company that energizes the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.

title: Lead Process Monitoring Engineer
description:
**Job Description Summary**
===========================


Are you passionate about cutting-edge technology and innovation? Do you want to be part of a team that's transforming industries with advanced metal additive manufacturing? If so, we have an exciting opportunity as Lead Process Monitoring Engineer for you at Colibrium Additive based in Gothenburg– a GE Aerospace company!  

  

Your Role: As a Lead Process Monitoring Engineer, you will be at the forefront of designing and developing highly complex modules and critical components for our additive manufacturing technology. Your focus will be on Electron Beam Melting (EBM) machine technology, driving the design and development efforts related to process monitoring capabilities.**Job Description**
===================

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Design and develop signal processing solutions for in-situ sensor feedback integration in additive machines.
* Acquire, analyze, and program sensor data to optimize additive manufacturing process parameters.
* Integrate new sensor functions and modules into our product families.
* Verify the functionality of new modules and features.
* Develop user interfaces and applications using OpenCV, Python, C++, and C#.
* Collaborate with customers to understand and meet their business needs.
* Lead the in-situ monitoring roadmap, including organizing sensor technology IP and aligning with partners.
* Define requirements for in-situ functions and modules with Product Management and stakeholders.
* Conduct development testing and code reviews.
* Continuously improve our processes and comply with project plans and industry standards.

**Required Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or STEM majors (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math).
* Minimum of 5 years of professional experience in software development with OpenCV, Python, C++, C#, or equivalent.
* Proven experience in statistically validating analytics algorithm performance.
* Knowledge and experience with Linux operating systems.
* Prior experience in high-speed data analytics, image analysis, and sensor utilization.
* Strong knowledge of git source control tools and best practices.
* Experience working with containers (e.g., Docker).

**About Us:** Colibrium Additive - part of GE Aerospace- is a global leader in metal additive design and manufacturing. Our pioneering processes empower businesses to create innovative products that solve complex manufacturing challenges, improve outcomes, and make a positive impact on the world. Our state-of-the-art metal 3D printers are designed by our expert engineering teams, manufactured in Sweden and Germany, and used worldwide in industries such as aerospace, medical, and more.

**Why Join Us?**

* **Innovative Environment:** Work with the most advanced metal 3D printers in the world.
* **Global Collaboration:** Collaborate with colleagues in Germany, India, the US, and customers worldwide.
* **Agile and Dynamic:** Enjoy the benefits of a smaller, agile company with the support of a global enterprise.
* **Inclusive Culture:** Colibrium Additive is an Equal Opportunity Employer where inclusion matters.
* **Work-Life Balance:** Flexible working arrangements and a positive work-life balance.
* **Comprehensive Benefits:** Flexible working hours, health and pension insurance benefits, and more.

**Join Us and Make a Difference:**At GE Aerospace, we believe that our people make the difference. As a new joiner, you'll enjoy a fun, flexible, and technically advanced working environment. You'll gain valuable experience, interact with highly committed colleagues from different cultures, and contribute to your future development.


Ready to take the next step in your career? Apply now and be part of a team that's changing the world for the better!

**Additional Information**
==========================

**Relocation Assistance Provided:** No
company_description: GE Aerospace invents the future of flight, lifts people up, and brings them home safely.

title: Analysis Leader
description:
**Fantastic challenges. Amazing opportunities.**

  


GKN Aerospace is reimagining air travel: going further, faster and greener! Fuelled by great people whose expertise and creativity sets the standards in our industry, we’re inspired by the opportunities to innovate and break boundaries. We’re proud to play a part in protecting the world’s democracies. And we’re committed to putting sustainability at the centre of everything we do, opening up and protecting our planet. With over 16,000 employees across 33 manufacturing sites in 12 countries we serve over 90% of the world’s aircraft and engine manufacturers and achieved sales of £3.35 bn.in 2023. There are no limits to where you can take your career.


**About Us**
------------



The Global Technology Center (GTC) is where we at GKN Aerospace work together to develop the technologies for the future. We make it possible for the company to meet the current and future challenges of the industry, to offer better products to our customers and to grow as a market leader. We work to deliver a sustainable aviation.  

To fulfill our mission, we establish and maintain strategic technology relationships/partnerships with key customers, companies and academia, we find new R&D opportunities that help us to mature technologies to TRL 6, we manage IP, we invest in infrastructure, and especially, we invest in our people.  



**About the Role**
------------------

  

The Product Verification department at GTC is a team of 12 skilled solid mechanics working in different multidisciplinary project teams dedicated to the design and development of future product solutions for commercial engines, and we are now looking for an Analysis Leader to help us in our task of reaching the goal of sustainable aeroengines. As an Analysis Leader you will play a key role in the design of our aerospace components and contributes significantly to the development of methods and tools.  

The role consists of two main components: one involves leading, planning and reviewing the work in your solid mechanics team, while the other involves performing advanced mechanical simulations yourself.


You have a big interest in and feel the responsibility for leading and developing a team and the team members. Also you are a highly skilled Mechanical Engineer with a keen interest in the aerospace industry and extensive expertise in ANSYS and Python. Capable of handling the team activities within complex structural mechanics and scripting challenges.  

Are you interested in being part of the development of the next generation aeroengines?  

  

  

**Employment**  

This is a full-time permanent position. The place of employment is at our main site in Trollhättan, Sweden and as such, the applicant should be able to gain the right to live and work in the country. Occasional travel is to be expected, both within and outside Sweden.  



**Job Responsibilities**
------------------------


* Leading a Solid Mechanics team, responsible for the deliverables to the project.
* Assure proper documentation of technical results and present the results internally and externally.
* Work in multidisciplinary teams engaged in the design and development of jet engine structures including new technologies or features.
* Drive the Dimensioning and verification of engine components through FE analysis (strength, fatigue, fracture mechanics, dynamic analysis) using both commercial (ANSYS) and in-house developed tools.
* Ensure the continuous air worthiness of our certified products by analyzing field events and propose actions.
* Know how to develop and implement custom Python scripts and tools to enhance engineering processes.
* Drive the develop analysis methods.
* Contribute to the development of GKN as a 'Great Place to Work', aligned with the core principles - safe, innovative, open & honest, care & respect, and ownership.

  

**Job Qualifications**
----------------------


* Master's Degree in Applied Mechanics: You hold a Master's degree in Applied Mechanics or a related field.
* Ability to inspire, motivate, and guide team members towards common goals.
* ANSYS Proficiency: You have extensive experience with ANSYS software.
* Python Programming Skills: You are used to solve problems by Python programming, enabling you to automate processes, conduct data analysis, and develop custom solutions.
* Passion for Aerospace: You have a passion for the aerospace industry.
* Solid Mechanics and Material Science: Your knowledge in solid mechanics and material science is robust, allowing you to tackle challenges related to structural integrity, material properties, and component performance.
* Proficient in English.


  

**Desirable qualification:**
* Knowledge from manufacturing process, both conventional and additive manufacturing, is consider advantageous.
* Swedish is considered advantageous.

  

**Personal Skills**
-------------------



For this role you should have leadership as a strength, find big interest in creating plans and ability to inspire, motivate and guide team members. You have deep understanding of solid mechanics: structural analysis, fatigue, fracture mechanics, dynamic analysis of structures. Also you are a problem solver who feels energized when facing technical challenges.


**Application**
---------------



Do not wait to submit your application! The selection process starts when the ad is published and the position may be filled before the final application date.

  

  

**Last date for application:** 2025.04.06

  

  

For more information please contact  

Erika Dhejne | GTC Engineering Manager | GKN Aerospace Engine Systems Sweden  

Tel. +46 700872129  



The position requires that you undergo and be approved according to the current regulations for security protection. For positions where GKN's customer has requirements for security classification, this may, in some cases, involve specific citizenship requirements.  



Do not wait to submit your application! The selection process starts when the ad is published and the position may be filled before the final application date.

  

  

**Last date for application:** 2025.04.06

  

  

For more information please contact  

Erika Dhejne | GTC Engineering Manager | GKN Aerospace Engine Systems Sweden  

Tel. +46 700872129  



The position requires that you undergo and be approved according to the current regulations for security protection. For positions where GKN's customer has requirements for security classification, this may, in some cases, involve specific citizenship requirements.  



We’ll offer you fantastic challenges and amazing opportunities. This is your chance to be part of an organisation that has proven itself to be at the cutting edge of our industry; and is committed to pushing the boundaries even further. And with some of the best training on offer in the industry, who knows how far you can go?

  


**A Great Place to work needs a Great Way of Working**

  


Everyone is welcome to apply to GKN. We believe that we can only achieve our ambitions through a coming together of diverse minds who enjoy collaborating in an inspirational environment. Through our commitment to diversity, inclusion and belonging and by living our five powerful principles we’ve created a culture where everyone feels welcome to contribute. It’s a culture that won us ‘The Best Workplace Culture Award’. By embracing and celebrating what makes us unique we encourage everyone to bring their full self to work.


We’re also committed to providing an accessible recruitment process, so if you require reasonable adjustments at any stage during our recruitment process please get in touch and let us know.


We are the place where human dreams, plus human endeavour, shape the future of aerospace innovation and technology.
